Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka yā man dhātuka bi-dhātik wa-ṣifātuka bi-maʻānīka lā bi-dhātik, wa-nuṣallī wa-nusallimu ʻalá al-muballigh lil-aḥkām wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih dhawī al-itqān wa-al-iḥkām, wa-nashhadu an lā ilāha illā ant, wa-narāka bi-lā mithāl, wa-nashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan rasūluka al-ṣādiq fī kull ḥāl. Wa-baʻd, fayaqūlu faqīr raḥmat rabbihi al-dayyān Muḥammad al-Ḥudaynī al-Damanhuwī [al-Damanhūrī] mubtaghī al-ghufrān innahu lammā kānat al-manẓūmah allatī anshaʼahā Shaykhunā al-Najjārī sahlat al-tanāwul yakhāḍu fī maʻānī baḥrihā al-jārī, ḥāwaltu an ashraḥahā bi-sharḥ yuzīlu ghiṭāhā wa-yubayyinu min al-marām mā inṭawá taḥta khibāhā, walāsīyamā wa-qad ashāra ʻalayya bi-hi Shaykhunā al-madhkūr fa-jāʼa bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi mubashshiran bi-al-surūr. Wa-sammaytuhu Futūḥāt al-rashīd ʻalá Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd. Wa-Allāh asʼal an yanfaʻanā bi-mā qaṣadnāh wa-yaksuwahu thawb al-qabūl ..."
Secundo folio: Qāla al-nāẓim bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 23-34 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in three unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the original text in red; numerous notes and corrections on the margins; an insert between quires two and three; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Seven verses of Sufi poetry on "waḥdat al-wujūd" (unity of existence), probably by the well-known Sufi and poet Abū Madyan al-Tilimsānī (died 1197 or 1198) which starts with: Allāha qul wa-dhari al-wujūda wa-mā ḥawá // in kunta murtādan bulūgha kamāli.

Colophon: "Ilá hunā waqafat al-aqlām. Nasʼalu Allāh al-ʻafwa ʻan zallat al-aqdām bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām, wa-man tabiʻahum bi-amān ilá al-khitām. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tabyīḍ muʻzam hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak fī Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼtayn wa-thamān wa-ʻishrīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man tabiʻahum fī al-mabdaʼ wa-al-khitām." At the margin of the the colophon: "Qawluhu 'muʻẓam' ilkh: Innamā qāla dhālik, li-anna al-muʼallif lam yubayyiḍ khātimat al-taṣawwuf illā fī al-sanah allatī talī al-thāminah wa-al-ʻishrīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Here, the pens stopped. We ask God forgiveness for the slip of the feet, through the intercession of our Master Muḥammad, the best of the people, his honorable companions, and those who faithfully follow in their path until the end. Most of this blessed commentary was written in Jumādá al-Awwal, the year 1228 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon him, and upon his family, his companions and those who followed them from the beginning to the end." At the margin of the colophon: "His saying 'most', etc.: He said this because the author did not write the conclusion of his treatise on Sufism except in the year that followed the twenty-eighth."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Lāmīyat al-afʻāl : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Ibn al-Nāẓim.

notes.text: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ḥabr al-humām Badr al-Dīn Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn al-Imām al-ʻallāmah Jamāl al-Dīn Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik al-Jayyānī al-Andalusī al-Ṭāʼī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Hādhihi awrāq tashtamilu ʻalá sharḥ qaṣīdat wālidī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fī abniyat al-afʻāl wa-mā yattaṣilu bi-hā, wa-ʻalá dhikr mā yuḥtāju ilayhi min al-amthilah, wa-īḍāḥ mā istubhima wa-tafsīr al-gharīb ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ḍamm min faʻula ilzam.
14.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 8 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in three quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of the original in purple; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folios 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Lāmīyat al-afʻāl li-ibn nāẓimihā, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi."
On folio 1a: Three verses of poetry about the seven different kinds of the trilateral verb in Arabic.
Folios 23-24 are blank.

Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhih ghurrat al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1288, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh Sālim Ḥasan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi fī Allāh wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary is concluded by the praise of God and His help. Copied at the beginning of al-Ḥijjah, the year 1288 [11 February, 1872], by the poor to God Sālim Ḥasan, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren in God and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

title: 880-02 al-Maqṣad al-asná fī sharḥ asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná : manuscript / Abū Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī.

notes.text: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, ḥujjat al-Islām al-Ghazzālī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu: Ammā qawluhu "Allāh", fahuwa ism al-mawjūd al-ḥaqq, al-jāmiʻ li-ṣifāt al-ilāhīyah, al-manʻūt bi-nuʻūt al-rubūbīyah, al-munfarid bi-al-wujūd al-ḥaqīqī, fa-inna kull mawjūd siwāh ghayr mustaḥiqq lil-wujūd bi-dhātihi, wa-innamā istafād al-wujūd minhu, fa-huwa min ḥaythu dhātihi hālik, wa-min al-jihah allatī talīh mawjūd ..."
Secundo folio: yuṭlaqu ʻalayhi al-ism ka-al-Raḥīm.
17 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in six unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Maqṣad al-asná fī sharḥ asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Ghazzālī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Tamm."

Colophon: "Tammat Asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, ākhir shahr Ṣafar alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-sabʻīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná [The Most Beautiful Names of God] is concluded by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Copied on blessed Monday, the end of Ṣafar, 1175 [29 September, 1761]. It is concluded."

title: 880-02 Bahjat al-sāmiʻīn wa-al-nāẓirīn bi-mawlid Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākharīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ghayṭī.

notes.text: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-rāsikh al-kāmil al-ruḥalah al-fahhāmah, Shaykh al-Muslimīn, khātimat al-ḥuffāẓ wa-al-muḥaddithīn, al-ḥujjah Najm al-Dīn, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ghayṭī al-Shāfiʻī, khādim al-Sunnah al-sharīfah, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā min barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anāra bi-mawlid Aḥmad al-Muṣṭafá, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, jamīʻ al-wujūd, wa-aẓhar shams faḍl Nabīyinā al-mujtabá, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, fa-kāna lil-ʻibād saʻd al-suʻūd, wa-khalaqa nūrahu min nūrihi qabla ījād kull mawjūd ..."
Secundo folio: Mādhā yaqūlu al-mādiḥūn wa-madḥuhu.
15.3 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 10 x 14.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Bahjat al-nāẓirīn wa-al-sāmiʻīn bi-mawlid Sayyid al-Mursalīn wa-al-ākharīn, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ruḥalah, khādim al-Sunnah al-Nabawīyah, Najm al-Dīn al-Ghayṭī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḥimanā. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A copying and ownership statement: "ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi, thumma li-man shāʼa al-Mawlá baʻdah, Muḥammad al-Shaṭṭī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

On folio 19b: A copying and ownership statement: "ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi, wa-li-man shāʼa al-Mawlá baʻda waḍʻihi fī ramsihi, Muḥammad al-Shaṭṭī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Qāla shaykh mashāyikhinā muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḥimanā bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah: Wāfaqa al-farāgh min tabyīḍ hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Sabt, rābiʻ ʻishrīn Ṣafar, min shuhūr thamānīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "The master of our masters, the author of this book, may God have mercy upon him and upon us through him, in this world and in the hereafter, said: The writing of this book was completed on Saturday, 24 Ṣafar, 980 [16 July, 1572]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, his companions, his wives, and his descendants. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God alone."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sullam : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.

notes.text: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khaṣṣ al-insān bi-al-manṭiq al-faṣīḥ ʻammā fī al-ḍamīr min al-maknūnāt, wa-afāḍ ʻalá riyāḍ ʻaqlihi ghayth saḥāʼib al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī al-ʻafwa min al-Khabīr al-Laṭīf Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī al-dhalīl al-ḍaʻīf ibn Muḥammad al-Jīzāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu jamīʻ al-masāwī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥ Allāh lī wa-la-hu al-ḥāl wa-al-shān kitābatan badīʻah al-niẓām takshufu ʻan al-muqddimah al-shahīrah bi-al-Sullam al-lithām, ʻalá muʼallifihā al-riḍá wa-al-iḥsān min al-Mawlá al-Karīm al-Raḥmān ..."
Secundo folio: al-tashbīh al-balīgh wa-lā yajūzu.
16.7 x 23.3 cm; written surface: 11 x 18.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in six numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the "al-Sullam" preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; some markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah Mawlānā Shaykh al-Islām Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī ʻalá al-Sullam bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥmadu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāll."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min jamʻ hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah al-nafīsah fī awāʼil Jumādá al-Ūlá min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittah wa-ʻishrīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā ṣalawāt wa-taḥīyāt sharīfah. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam.

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said: This precious gloss was compiled at the beginning of Jumādá al-Ūlá, 1226 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may noble prayers and greetings be upon Him. There is no might nor power except in God, the Most High, the Almighty. He suffices me. He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and His companions and grant the peace."

title: 880-02 Tashṭīr Burdat al-madīḥ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Ḥamad al-Sharqāwī.

notes.text: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh mujrī aqlām al-tasṭīr bi-al-tashṭīr, wa-mursī sufun al-ʻazāyim bi-barr al-maqāṣid an ṭābaqa sābiq al-taqdīr, wa-sāʼiq khawāṭir al-ḥarakāt ilá qulūb dhawī al-tafkīr, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-mamdūḥ fī al-Kitāb al-munīr bi-mā taḍammana min al-āyāt annahu al-bashīr al-nadhīr, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-ummatihi, al-ijābah min kull kabīr wa-ṣaghīr. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-muḍṭarr ilá al-iḥsān, al-rājī nafaḥāt al-minnah wa-al-jūd wa-al-ḥanān, kabīr al-dhunūb wa-kathīr al-masāwī Aḥmad ibn Ḥamad ibn ʻUthmān al-Sharqāwī al-Ṣaʻīdī al-Jirjāwī, tābiʻ al-Shams al-Ḥifnāwī: Baynamā anā taʼihun fī tīh al-ghafalāt, lāhin lahwa al-ṣibā, maʻa ishtighāl al-raʼs bi-nadhīr hādim al-ladhdhāt, idh warada ʻalá khāṭirī tashṭīr Burdat al-madīḥ, naẓm al-Imām al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, al-balīgh al-faṣīḥ al-Ustādh Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Būṣīrī ..."
Secundo folio: arkabu jawād al-himmah ḥīnan.
16.2 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of "al-Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Tashṭīr Burdat al-madīḥ lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-baḥr al-fahhāmah Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Sharqāwī ibn Ḥamad ibn ʻUthmān, tābiʻ al-Walī al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shams al-Ḥifnāwī."

al-Sharqāwī starts his poem with: Bismi al-Ilāhi mufīḍi al-jūdi wa-al-niʻami // badaʼtu naẓman ḥalá dhikran bi-kulli fami. And starts his "Tashṭīr" with: Amin tadhakkuri jīrānin bi-Dhī Salami // jazamta annaka maqṣūrun ʻalá al-alami. Wa-ʻindamā hājati al-dhikrá wa-lawʻatuhā // mazajta damʻan jará min muqlatin bi-dami. And ends it with: Mā rannaḥat ʻadhabāti al-bāni rīḥu ṣabā // wa-mā ṣabā qalbu mushtāqin ilá al-Ḥarami. Wa-mā atá ʻīdu waṣlin baʻda tafriqatin // wa-aṭraba al-ʻīsa ḥādī al-ʻīsi bi-al-naghami.

Colophon: "Tamma al-Tashṭīr al-mubārak ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Saʻūdī al-Yūnusī, wa-dhālika ḍaḥwat yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, ḥādī ʻashar Ṣafar al-khayr alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1195, khamsah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. Wa-kutiba bi-rasm fakhr al-Sādah al-Ashrāf al-muʻaẓẓamīn, nukhbat Āl Ṭāhā wa-Yāsīn, farʻ al-shajarah al-zakīyah wa-aḥsanuhā, wa-ṭirāz al-ʻiṣābah al-Hāshimīyah wa-ajmaluhā, al-Sharīf al-ṭāhir, ḥāwī al-kamālāt wa-al-mafākhir, al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ibrāhīm, ḥafiẓahu Allāh. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed "Tashṭīr" is completed. Copied by the poor Muḥammad al-Saʻūdī al-Yūnusī, on Monday morning, 11 Ṣafar, 1195 [6 February, 1781], for al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ibrāhīm, the pride of the glorious al-Sādah al-Ashrāf, the epitome of Āl Ṭāhā wa-Yāsīn, the most noble scion of the pure tree, and the choicest and the finest of the Hashemite clan, the righteous Sharīf, he who is full of perfection and splendor, may God protect him. Amen."

title: 880-02 al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn al-ʻImād al-Aqfahsī.

notes.text: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī yumajjadu // wa-fī al-samāʼi ʻarshuhu wa-ashhadu. Bi-annahu al-Wāḥidu lā maḥālah // wa-al-Muṣṭafá al-Rasūlu bil-dilālah ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá ṣidāqin minhu bi-al-tahlīli.
15.2 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
Leaf 16 is blank; text folios 1b-15b.
Brockelmann gives the title as: "al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād" and "al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻuqqād" (GAL: G II 94; S II 111,17).

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb fīhi Naẓm al-iqtiṣād fī kifāyat inʻiqād [al-ʻiqād]. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihi. Taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, awḥad mashāyikh al-zamān, Shihāb al-Dīn, Abī al-ʻAbbās, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah ʻImād al-Dīn, ʻImād al-Aqfahsī al-Shāfiʻī."

On folio 1a: Two ownership notes, as follows: "Tamallaka hādhihi al-nuskhah ʻAbd al-Qādir Shaʻbān al-Ṣiddīq." "Min niʻam Allāh ʻalá ʻAbdihi al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Maḥallī al-Ṣiddīqī."
On folio 15b: Ownership note: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Min niʻam Allāh ʻalá ʻabdihi ʻAbd al-Qādir sibṭ ibn al-Ṣiddīq. ʻUfiya ʻanhu bi-mannih. Āmīn."
On folio 16b: Ownership note: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Min niʻam Allāh ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Anṣārī al-Maḥallī al-Ṣiddīqī."

Colophon: The poem ends with: "... Wa-Ibnu al-ʻImādi ṭālibun min Dhī al-Karam // wa-Dhī al-Jalāl wa-al-Kamāl fī al-qidam. Luṭfan bi-hi fī sāyiri al-awqāt // wa-raḥmatan taʻummu fī al-mamāti. Tamma Naẓm al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād."

Translation of the colophon: The poem ends with:"... Ibn al-ʻImād asks the Generous One // the Glorious and Perfect one of yore. For kindness in all times // and abundant mercy after death. The poem 'al-iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād' is completed."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād : manuscript / al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Nassāb.

notes.text: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaq al-khalq bi-qudratih, wa-dabbar al-ashyāʼ bi-ḥikmatih, wa-khalaqa Ādam fa-aḥsana taqwīm ṣūratih, wa-istakhraja al-ʻibād min ʻunṣurihi wa-dhurrīyatih, wa-jaʻalahum shuʻūban wa-qabāʼila li-yataʻārafū, wa-ʻarrafahum bi-waḥdānīyatih, fa-man ittaqāhu wa-khashiyahu askanahu dāra karāmatih, wa-man ʻaṣāhu wa-khālafahu sāqahu li-niqmatih, fa-minhum shaqī wa-saʻīd, wa-qarīb min bābihi wa-baʻīd ... Wa-baʻd, yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat rabbihi al-karīm al-wahhāb, al-Sharīf al-Ḥasan al-Ḥasanī al-Shāfiʻī al-Nassāb ibn Muḥammad ibn Ayyūb ... ibn al-Ḥasan al-Sibṭ ibn Amīr al-Muʼminīn ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib ... min Fāṭimah al-Zahrāʼ, ibnat Sayyid al-Mursalīn wa-Khātim al-Nabīyīn, Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn, innahu istakhāra Allāh taʻālá fī jamʻ sharḥ ʻalá mā naẓamahu al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn al-ʻImād [...] al-Aqfahsī al-Shāfiʻī ... alladhī wa-samahu bi-al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād, li-yaḥsula al-kashf ʻan mushkilih wa-mubhamih, maʻa mā aḍummu ilayhi ... min al-ziyādāt allatī lā budda minhā li-ṭālibih ..."
Secundo folio: raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-qawluhu.
18 x 24 cm; written surface: 13 x 19 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of "al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-iʻtiqād" and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād, Sharḥ Qaṣīdat Ibn al-ʻImād, lil-Sayyid al-Nassāb, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."

At the end of his colophon the copyist mentions that he read in the copy he used that the author is the genealogist of "al-Sādah al-Ashrāf" (descendants of the Prophet Muḥammad from his daughter Fāṭimah), as follows: "al-Sayyid al-Sharīf, al-ḥasīb al-nasīb, al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, al-ʻallāmh, dhū al-baṣāʼir al-bāhirah wa-al-ʻulūm al-zāhirah [...] Abū Muḥammad al-Ḥasan al-Ḥasanī al-Nassāb, nassāb al-Sādah al-Ashrāf."
On folios 151a-151b: Sayings, written in a different hand, about the characteristics of the seven days of the week and what happens if garments are cut out, or nails clipped, in each one of them.
On folio 151b: A date is mentioned, as follows: "Jumādá al-Ākhirah 1068 [March/April, 1658]."

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassara Allāh bi-hi min sharḥ hādhā al-kitāb. Allāhumma akhliṣ fīhi al-nīyah, wa-ṣaḥḥiḥ bi-hi al-qaṣd al-jamīl, wa-balligh fīhi al-umniyah, wa-irḥam man ʻallamanā, wa-lā tukhib rajāʼanā fīka wa-muʻtaqadanā, wa-ifʻal binā mā anta la-hu ahl, wa-lā takilnā ilá anfusinā wa-lā ilá maʻrifatinā, innaka ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Wa-saʼaltu Allāh taʻālá an yajʻalahu dhakhīrah li-qārīhi wa-sāmiʻihi, wa-wasīlah li-rāwīhi wa-jāmiʻih, fa-Huwa arḥam man ajāb wa-akram man anāb ... Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what God facilitated concerning the commentary on this book. O God make sincere [our] intention, and trustworthy [our] motive. Fulfill in it [our] wishes. Have mercy upon those who taught us. Do not disappoint our hope and faith in You. Treat us favorably and do not let us depend on ourselves or our knowledge. You are able to do whatever You want, and to answer our requests. I ask God Almighty to make this book an asset to its reader, and he who hears it, and a mediation to its transmitter and compiler. He is the most merciful and the most compassionate ... God is more knowledgeable of what is true. To Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. God suffices us. He is the best advocate."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat [... ... ...] al-mubārak min [... ... ...] faqīr raḥmat rabbih ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Bakr [...] al-Azʹharī [...], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was concluded [... ... ...] on blessed [... ... ...] by the poor to the mercy of his Lord, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Bakr [...] al-Azʹharī [...], may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 Taḥrīr al-fatāwī fī taṣḥīḥ al-Ḥāwī : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī al-Qūnawī.

notes.text: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam taslīman. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ajall al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Muḥibb al-Dīn Maḥmūd ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Abī al-Ḥasan al-Qūnawī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatihi wa-al-tābiʻīn lahum bi-iḥsān ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-lammā kāna al-ʻamal fī hādhā al-zamān ʻalá mā rajjaḥahu al-Imāmān, al-Imām al-Rāfiʻī wa-al-Shaykh Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawāwī, istakhartu Allāh taʻālá fī jamʻ mukhtaṣar unabbihu fīhi ʻalá mā waqaʻa fī al-Ḥāwī lil-Shaykh Najm al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Ghaffār al-Qazwīnī min al-masāyil al-mukhālifah li-tarjīḥihā, aw tarjīḥ aḥadihimā, wa-mā waqaʻa fīhi min al-masāʼil al-muṭlaqah, wa-qad qayyadāhā, aw qayydahā aḥaduhumā bi-qayd, wa-rubbamā ushīru fī baʻḍ al-mawāḍiʻ ilá fāʼidah naqalahā al-Baghawī, aw ṣāḥib al-Miṣbāḥ, aw ṣāḥib al-Muʻtamad, aw ghayruhum, ka-ṣāḥib al-Baḥr, wa-al-Māwardī ṣāḥib al-Ḥāwī al-kabīr, wa-ṣāḥib al-Shāmil, wa-ṣāḥib al-Tatimmah, wa-ghayruhum. Wa-Allāh aʻlam ... wa-qad ḍammantuhu mā taʻarraḍa la-hu wālidī, raḥimahu Allāh, fī sharḥihi min dhālik. Wa-sammaytuhu Taḥrīr al-fatāwī fī taṣḥīḥ al-Ḥāwī. Wa-Allāh asʼal an yanfaʻa bi-hi muʼallifahu wa-kātibahu wa-al-nāẓira fīhi wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn bi-mannihi wa-karamih ..."
Secundo folio: min ḥaythu al-dalīl annahu lā yukrahu.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap.

In beautiful Maghribī script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes without loss of text; markings in red; the phrases of the original (al-Ḥāwī al-ṣaghīr) preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; no catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Taḥrīr al-fatāwī fī taṣḥīḥ al-Ḥāwī, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻāmil al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah Muḥibb al-Dīn Maḥmūd ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Abī al-Ḥasan ʻAlī al-Qūnawī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāh. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: "Fī nawbat al-faqīr Muḥammad Salīm al-Ḥamzāwī, sanat 265 [1265] = [1848/1849]". "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr al-Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maghribī, sanat 128 [1128] = [1715/1716]".

On folio 98a: An "Ijāzah" (a license to transmit the contents of a book) by the author, Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī al-Qūnawī, to Taqī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻIzz al-Dīn Yūsuf, dated Wednesday, 12 Jumādá al-Ūlá, 742 (1 November, 1341). The license is written in a different hand. It is not clear whether it is in the handwriting of the author, al-Qūnawī (which constitutes an anachronism, since the manuscript was copied in 1535), or some other person: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Baḥatha maʻī mawāḍiʻ min hādhā al-kitāb al-Shaykh al-faqīh al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, al-muḥaṣṣil, jamāl al-fuḍalāʼ, Taqī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām ʻIzz al-Dīn Yūsuf al-Khaṭīb bi-Mārdīn al-maḥrūsah, wa-ajaztu la-hu an yarwiyahu ʻannī. Wa-kataba muʼallifuhu Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī al-Qūnawī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu, fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, thānī ʻashar Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat ithnatayn wa-arbaʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah."
On folio 98a: Ten quotations on "al-taqwá" (righteousness), attributed to different persons.
On folio 98b: An index of books housed at an unidentified location.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā jamʻahu fī hādhā al-mukhtaṣar, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Nuqila min khaṭṭ al-muʼallif al-ʻālim [...] Abī al-Thanāʼ Maḥmūd al-Qūnawī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi al-muʼallif wa-al-qāriʼ wa-al-nāsikh wa-jamʻuhum, maʻa jamīʻ al-Muslimīn fī jannāt al-naʻīm. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi fī al-ʻushr al-akhīr min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, min sanat ithnayn wa-arbaʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. [And in a different handwriting] "Wa-min taṣnīfihi ʻalá mā qāla muʼallifuhu, ʻafā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu, fī ākhir Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat iḥdá wa-arbaʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah, siwá iḍāfāt uzīdat baʻda dhālika. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to compile in this compendium. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. Copied from the handwriting of the author, the learned [...] Abī al-Thanāʼ Maḥmūd al-Qūnawī. May God benefit with it the author, the reader, the copyist and their cohorts, and all Muslims, in the gardens of bliss. Amen. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Copied during the last tenth of the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 942 [beginning of November, 1535]. And in a different handwriting: "Written, according to what its author, may God pardon him, said, at the end of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 741 [30 October, 1340], excluding some additions appended thereafter. Praise be to God alone."

title: 880-02 Nubdhah mukhtaṣarah fī al-kitāb al-musammá al-Kawākib al-durrīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-sirrīyah : manuscript.

notes.text: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi wa-ahl baytihi wa-al-tābiʻīn. Hādhihi Nubdhah mukhtaṣarah fī al-kitāb al-musammá "al-Kawākib al-durrīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-sirrīyah". Fa-min al-qawāʻid, athbit al-takht al-khārij bi-al-ḍarb, wa-athbit fawqa kull shakl ussahu al-kabīr alladhī bi-ziyādat al-marātib, thumma ʻudda al-ʻanāṣir al-nārrīyah al-mufradah allatī fī al-takht, wa-khudh ʻadadahā, ijʻalhu li-ʻunṣur al-nār fī kull shakl. Wa-ʻudda ʻanāṣir al-hawá al-mufradah allatī fī al-takht wa-khudh ʻadadahā, ijʻalhu li-ʻunṣur al-hawá fī kull shakl. Wa-ʻudda ʻanāṣir al-māʼ al-mufradah, wa-khudh ʻadadahā, ijʻalhu li-ʻunṣr al-māʼ fī kull shakl. Wa-ʻudda ʻanāṣir al-turāb al-mufradah, ijʻalhu li-ʻunṣr al-turāb fī kull shakl, thumma zawwij al-ashkāl li-baʻḍihā ..."
Secundo folio: fīhi ʻan kayfīyat al-sayr.
15.3 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 17.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.
In clear and beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover, in pencil two names are written: "Ṣaʻb Ṣāliḥ wa-Ḥamad al-Ḥammūd."

On folio 38b: The name of a certain Ṣufī, a location, and a date are mentioned, as follows: "... Wa-hādhā takht maḍrūb fī sāḥat Shaykhinā wa-Ustādhinā al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, qudwat al-sālikīn wa-murabbī al-murīdīn, Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Dimirdāshī [could not be identified], wa-kāna dhālika ʻalá ḥāffat al-Khalīj, qibāl Jāmiʻ al-Zāwiyah al-Ḥamrāʼ [could not be identified], qubayl al-ʻaṣr, yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, ʻashar Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat 1249, tisʻ wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf [25 October, 1833] ..."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Aḥad, li-arbaʻat ayyām maḍat min shahr al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat ithnayn wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-majd wa-al-sharaf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-askananā wa-īyāhum aʻlá al-ghuraf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Khūjah, ʻafā Allāh ʻanh. Tamma al-kitāb takāmalat // niʻamu al-surūri li-ṣāḥibih. Wa-ʻafā al-Ilāhu bi-faḍlihi // wa-bi-mannihi ʻan kātibih."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of the Generous King, on Sunday, 4 al-Ḥijjah, 1302 of the Hijrah of the glorious and honorable Prophet [14 September, 1885]. May God pray on him, his family, his companions and their followers, May He allocate to us with them the loftiest chambers [in Paradise]. Copied by the poor and despised Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Khūjah, may God forgive him. The book is completed // may the blessings of joy be perfected to its owner. May God pardon, by His favor // and generosity, its copyist."

title: 880-02 Ighāthat al-muḥtājīn min al-ummah al-Muḥammadīyah li-ḥall alfāẓ al-Istighāthah al-Būnīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī Makkī al-Khalwatī al-Ḥifnāwī.

notes.text: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāh nāṣir kull ṣābir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-tawassul bi-aḥbāb Allāh yanfaʻu dunyā wa-ukhrá, wa-jaʻalahum al-wasāʼil ilá al-ḥabīb al-aʻẓam, wa-al-wasāʼiṭ ilá wuṣūl al-sabīl al-aqwam. Wa-aʻẓim bihim dhukhran. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī naṭaqa bi-mazāyāhu al-Kitāb wa-al-Tanzīl, wa-ḥabāhu bi-raqāʼiq al-takrīm wa-al-tabjīl, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi maṣābīḥ al-dujá al-ḥawālik wa-al-nāshilīn li-kull gharīq hālik, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻ al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-murtajī ghafr al-masāwī ʻAlī Makkī al-Khalwatī al-Ḥifnāwī: Lammā raʼytu al-nufūs mutaʻashshiqah fī tilāwat Sūrat Yāsīn, wa-al-qulūb rāghibah fī al-istighāthah al-mashhūrah bi-Yā Al Yāsīn al-mansūbah lil-ʻārif billāh taʻālá Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Būnī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu al-matīn, allatī khammasahā baʻḍ al-ʻārifīn wa-nasajahā nasjan badīʻan yusirru qulūb al-sāmiʻīn wa-yaladhdhu aʻyun al-nāẓirīn, bi-qawlihi: 'Yā ʻuṣbata al-khayri bi-khayr al-milali', wa-bi-dhālika ṣārat wasīlah lil-ṭālibīn wa-dhakhīrah lil-rāghibīn wa-istighāthah yustaghāthu bi-hā ʻinda kull khaṭb mubīn, aḥbabtu an ajmaʻa ʻalá al-istighāthah al-ẓarīfah wa-al-wasīlah al-munīfah baʻḍ kalimāt takūnu ka-al-sharḥ taḥullu minhā al-mushkilāt ..."
Secundo folio: wa-istighāthah yustaghāth bi-hā.
16.7 x 24.2 cm; written surface: 10.3 x 16.3 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Istighāthah al-Būnīyah" in purple; markings in purple and violet; headings, some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ighāthat al-muḥtājīn min al-ummah al-Muḥammadīyah li-ḥall alfāẓ al-Istighāthah al-Būnīyah lil-Shaykh ʻAlī Makkī al-Khalwatī al-Ḥifnāwī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Tamm."

On folio 1a, around the title, a washed out endowment statement, in violet color, of which can be read "... fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻah, fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnah. Inna Allāh samīʻ ʻalīm. Kātibuhu Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl, 3 thalāthah Shawwāl, sanat 1335 [23 July, 1917]."
On folio 1a: Three anonymous pieces of poetry, two verses each.

On folio 22a: A Ṣūfī invocation in verse: "Takhmīs laṭīf li-baʻḍihim. Mā qaṭṭu aydī al-nadá ʻan jūdikum ḥujibat // wa-kull makrumatin min faḍlikum nusibat. Wa-qultu min mundhu rūḥī lil-asá khuṭibat // Yā Āla Ṭāhā ʻalaykum ḥamlatī ḥusibat // inna al-ḍaʻīfa ʻalá al-ajwādi maḥmūlu ..."

On folio 22a-23b: The full text of the invocation of "Daʻwat Yāsīn": "Hādhihi Daʻwat Yāsīn al-mukhammasah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā ʻuṣbat al-khayri bi-khayri al-milal // wa-nukhbata al-nūri al-bahīyi al-ajall ..." It ends with: "Innā daʻawnāka bi-ṣidqin ajib // qad quḍiya al-amru fa-qulnā ajal."
On folio 23b-25a: Three invocations inspired by Sūrat Yāsīn.

On folios 25a-25b: An invocation: "al-Abyāt al-aṣlīyah lil-Imām al-Suhaylī [ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh, 1114 or 1115-1185], wa-al-takhmīs lil-faqīh ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn Rashīq [could not be identified], raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá: In kunta ḥaqqan min dhunūbika tajzaʻu // fa-ifzaʻa ilá al-Bārī bi-qalbin yakhshaʻu ..."

On folio 25b: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá, kamā al-mūḍaḥ bi-awwal waraqah, fī 3 Shawwāl, sanat 1335, khamsah wa-thalāthūn Hijrīyah [23 July, 1917]. Kātibuhu Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl. Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl."
On folios 26a-27a: Another invocation by Aḥmad al-Būnī: "Hādhihi daʻwat al-Shaykh al-Būnī al-mashhūrah bi-al-nafʻ wa-al-ijābah. Wa-hiya hādhihi ..."
On folio 27b: An eschatological Ḥadīth about the End Time.

On folios 27b-29a: An invocation attributed to al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān (probably Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Sammān, al-Madanī, al-Khalwatī, al-Qādirī al-Shādhilī, Abū ʻAbd Allāh, 1718-1775): "Wa-hādhā ḥizb al-Ustādh al-aʻẓam Sayyidī al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Wa-huwa hādhā ..."
On folios 29a-29b: Recipe for easing the difficulty in giving birth.

On folio 29b: A medicinal recipe attributed to al-Shaykh al-Shaʻrānī (probably ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī, approximately 1493-1565 or 1566): "... wa-hiya tukhriju min al-jism ithnayn wa-sabʻīn dāʼan [... it rids the body of seventy two ailments] ..."
On folio 30a: A list of "Āyāt al-ḥifẓ" (Verses for "protection" which are mentioned in the Qurʼān).
On folio 30b: An incantation (with a magic square) against "al-Ḥummá" (Fever).
At the upper margin of all the leaves of the codex are written endowment statements, in violet: "Waqf" or "Waqf lillāh taʻālá".

Colophon (folios 21b-22a): "Tammat hādhihi al-istighāthah bi-sharḥihā bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, ʻalá atamm ḥāla wa-aḥsan minwāl, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam wa-sharrafa wa-karram. Katabahā al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muqirr bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafw Mawlāhu mūhib al-minan, ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl ibn Ḥasan, ghafar Allāh dhunūbah wa-satar fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbah. Āmīn. Fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, li-sittat ayyām khalat min shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah, ikhtitām ʻām ithnayn wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻzz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "The 'Invocation' is completed with its commentary, by the praise of God, His help and abundant benevolence, fully and thoroughly. God is the facilitator of what is right, to Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions, honor and exalt them. Written by the poor servant, he who admits his disability and insufficiency, who begs the forgiveness of his Lord, the granter of blessings, ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl ibn Ḥasan, may God forgive his sins and hide his imperfections, in the Two Abodes [here and in the thereafter]. Amen. On Wednesday, 6 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the conclusion of the year 1302 [16 September, 1885] of the Hijrah of the honorable and exalted Prophet, may prayer and peace of God be upon him."

title: 880-02 Manāzil al-arwāḥ : manuscript / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Kāfiyajī al-Ḥanafī.

notes.text: Title from folio 1a.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-nafs, wa-uthnī ʻalá man zakkāhā, wa-arsala Nabīyanā Muḥammad, Sayyid al-mursalīn, maḥyaduhu khayr al-bilād wa-azkāhā, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih, mā dāmat al-Shams wa-ḍuḥāhā. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah mushtamilah ʻalá muqaddimah wa-khamsat abwāb wa-khātimah. Ammā al-muqaddimah fa-fī bayān al-rūḥ wa-ḥudūthih, wa-fī bayān al-aqwāl fīhi ..."
Secundo folio: mithl al-rūḥ qāla Allāh taʻālá.
13.5 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14 cm; 15 lines per page.

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red and olive; text within red frame; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun dhālika ākhir al-kitāb. Fī yawm al-Jumʻah 18 shahr Shaʻbān, sanat 1125, khamsah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."
Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of the book. Dated, Friday, 18 Shaʻbān, 1125 [9 September, 1713]."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Uṣūl al-Ḥadīth : manuscript / Dāwūd ibn Muḥammad al-Qarṣī al-Ḥanafī.

notes.text: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Dāwūd Qarṣī. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aʻazza al-ʻulamāʼ al-ʻāmilīn wa-al-Muḥaddithīn al-ʻādilīn, wa-rafaʻa al-ḥāfiẓīn al-muttaṣilīn wa-al-munqaṭiʻīn al-wāqifīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá sayyid al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-muqtadīh ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-ghanī Dāwūd ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Qāriṣī al-Ḥanafī, ʻāmalahu Allāh taʻālá bi-luṭfihi al-jalī wa-al-khafī: Lammā badaʼtu bi-al-Bukhārī al-Sharīf, raʼaytu anna al-munāsib badʼ Risālat Fī uṣūl al-Ḥadīth qablahu, li-annahu yuḥtāju ilayhā, wa-lam ajid fī rasāʼil al-uṣūl aḥsan min hādhihi li-kawnihā aḥsanuhā taḥrīran, wa-atammuhā tartīban, wa-aktharuhā lil-uṣūl al-lāzimah jamʻihā [jamīʻihā], wa-qad thabut ʻindī, bi-khabar al-wāḥid, annahā lil-Imām al-ʻallāmah wa-al-fāḍil al-karāmah, waḥīd ʻaṣrihi fī al-taḥqīq wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi fī al-tadqīq Muḥammad Afandī al-Burkawī ..."
Secundo folio: li-kawnihā aḥsanuhā tartīban.
11.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather binding, both covers embossed with central medallions and tooled with a frame of rosettes.

In clear and beautiful naskh/taʻlīq script, slightly tilted to the right; in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; opening pages decorated with an ornament in gold, red, blue, yellow and black; text within double red frames; catchwords.
On the front of the preliminary leaf: "Risālah fī uṣūl al-Ḥadīth al-Nabawī li-Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, Shaykh al-Islām, Dāwūd al-Qarṣī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."
