Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Badīʻ al-maʻānī fī sharḥ ʻAqīdat al-Shaybānī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hādhā, wa-mā kunnā li-nahtadī lawlā an hadānā Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá min ilāh munazzah ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ, mutafarrid bi-ṣifāt al-kamāl, ghanī ʻammā siwāhu ... Ammā baʻd, fa-inna aʻẓam al-ʻulūm wa-aʻlāhā wa-aqwamahā ḥujjatan wa-ajlāhā ʻilm uṣūl al-dīn, al-musammá bi-ʻilm al-kalām, al-bāḥith ʻan dhāt al-ṣāniʻ wa-mā la-hu min ṣifāt al-jalāl wa-al-ikrām, wa-inna mimmā ullifa fīhi al-qaṣīdah al-fāʼiqat al-mabānī wa-al-maʻrūfah bi-Qaṣīdat al-Shaybānī ..."
Secundo folio for Badīʻ al-maʻānī fī sharḥ ʻAqīdat al-Shaybānī: yamnaʻu ʻan mā huwa aṣl.

Incipit of Sharḥ badʼ al-amālī (folio 28a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ʻudwāna illā ʻalá al-ẓālimīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyih Muḥammad, khātim al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-akramīn ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-muṣannif: Yaqūlu al-ʻabdu fī Badʼ al-amālī // li-tawḥīdin ka-naẓmin ka-al-laʼāli. Iʻlam inna muftataḥ kull bāb yanbaghī an yakūna muwashshaḥan bi-taḥmīd Allāh, muzayyanan bi-al-thanāʼ ʻalá Rasūlih ..."
Secundo folio for Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī: waḥdahu aw lā fa-lā.

Incipit of Sharḥ Mukhtaṣar ʻalá al-ʻaqīdah al-musammāh Badʼ al-amālī (folio 59b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Yaqūlu al-ʻabdu fī Badʼ al-amālī // li-tawḥīdin ka-naẓmin ka-al-laʼālī. al-Murād bi-al-ʻabd nafsuhu. al-Badʼ al-ibtidāʼ. al-Amālī jamʻ al-imlāʼ, wa-huwa al-katb ʻan ẓahr al-qalb min ghayr istiʻānah bi-kitāb. al-Murād bi-al-tawḥīd tawḥīd Allāh taʻālá, wa-huwa al-iqrār bi-al-lisān wa-al-taṣdīq bi-al-jinān annahu fī ḥadd dhātihi wāḥid fī ṣifātih ..."
Secundo folio for Sharḥ Mukhtaṣar ʻalá al-ʻaqīdah al-musammāh Badʼ al-amālī: ibtidāʼ wa-lā wāsiṭah bayna al-nafy wa-al-ithbāt.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 11 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.

Incipit of al-ʻUmdat al-aḥkām (folio 79b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla Mawlānā al-ṣadr al-Imām muqtadá al-anām fī al-ayyām, ḥabr al-ummah, baḥr al-Sunnah, majmaʻ al-iftāʼ wa-al-irshād, ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá al-ʻibād, muḥaqqiq al-maʻānī, muqarrir al-mabānī, kāshif al-daqāʼiq, mubayyin al-ḥaqāʼiq, ḥāfiẓ al-ḥaqq wa-al-millah wa-al-dīn, ṣadr al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, sulṭān ʻulamāʼ al-sharq wa-al-ṣīn, wārith ʻulūm al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, Abū al-Barakāt ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Maḥmūd al-Nasafī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu: Jamaʻtu fī hādhā al-mukhtaṣar ʻumdat ʻaqīdat Ahl al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum, ijābah lil-sāʼilīn wa-ṣawnan lahum ʻan ʻaqāʼid al-mubṭilīn ..."
Secundo folio of al-ʻUmdat al-aḥkām: khilāfan lil-Muʻtazilah li-kawnihi manāṭ al-taklīf.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap, dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a, at the upper right corner, in red: "Sharḥ al-ʻAqīdah al-Shaybānīyah, li-Shaykh al-Islām Ibn Qāḍī ʻAjlūn, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

On folio 1b: "... wa-ḥīna kāna hādhā al-sharḥ, fīmā ẓahara lanā, awwal sharḥ ullifa ʻalayhā, maʻa wafāʼihi bi-ḥall maqāṣidihā, wa-ibrāzihi al-maʻānī al-mustakinnah ladayhā, nāsaba an yusammá Badīʻ al-maʻānī fī sharḥ ʻAqīdat al-Shaybānī ..."

al-Ūshī's poem ends with: "Wa-innī al-Ḥaqqa adʻū kulla waqtin // li-man bi-al-khayri yawman qad daʻānī."

At the upper right corner of folio 28a, in red: "Ṣannafa hādhihi al-risālah fī al-tawḥīd al-mashhūrah bi-Yaqūlu al-ʻabd lil-Imām [al-Imām] al-fāḍil, Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, Sirāj al-Dīn, al-Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Shahīdī al-Ūshī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."
At the lower right margin of folio 58b: "Balagha muqābalatan bi-ḥasab al-ṭāqah."
On folio 59a: "Hādhā Sharḥ mukhtaṣar ʻalá al-ʻAqīdah al-musammāh Badʼ al-amālī."
On folio 79a: "Kitāb ʻUmdat al-aḥkām lil-Nasafī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."

May God forgive them and him who invokes God to forgive them and bestow His mercy upon them and all Muslims, by Your mercy, O Most Merciful One. The blessed book is concluded by the praise of God, His help and his abundant benevolence. The year 53 [probably 1153 = 1740/1741]."

Faṣl. al-Īmān billāh taʻālá farḍ ittifāqan, lākinna al-ʻaql ʻindanā ālah yuʻrafu bi-hā ḥusn al-ashyāʼ wa-qubḥuhā, wa-wujūb al-īmān wa-shukr al-munʻim, wa-al-muʻraf wa-al-mūjib ḥaqīqatan huwa Allāh, lākin bi-wāsiṭat al-ʻaql, kamā anna al-Rasūl muʻraf bi-al-wujūb, wa-al-mūjib ḥaqīqatan huwa Allāh, lākin bi-wāsiṭat al-Rasūl, ḥattá qāla Abū Ḥanīfah, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Lā ʻudhra li-aḥad fī al-jahl bi-khāliqih li-mā yurá ..."

All of it was copied from the blessed copy, dated in the year 740 of the Prophet [1339/1340], owned by al-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn [... ... ...]. It was collated and corrected, as much as possible and to the best of ability; may God, Most High, render it a blessing on him, and May God, Most High, benefit us by the blessings of its author. May God pray on Muḥammad and grant him abundant peace."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.

notes.text: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-mutabarrak bi-hi, waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥasanī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu bi-mannih wa-faḍlih: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wāsiʻ al-jūd wa-al-ʻaṭāʼ, alladhī shahidat bi-wujūb wujūdihi wa-waḥdānīyatihi wa-ʻaẓīm jalālihi wujūb iftiqār al-kāʼināt kullihā ilayh, fī al-arḍ wa-al-samāʼ, al-ʻazīz alladhī ʻazza fī mulkihi ʻan an yakūna la-hu sharīk fī tadbīr shayʼ mā, fa-taʻālá Rabbunā wa-jalla ʻan al-shurakāʼ wa-al-wuzarāʼ, al-Raḥīm al-Raḥmān, alladhī ʻammat niʻamuhu al-ʻawālim kullahā, fa-lā makhlaṣa li-kāʼin ʻan tilka al-naʻmāʼ, al-wāsiʻ al-karīm, al-munfarid bi-al-ījād, fa-lā yustaṭāʻu shukr niʻamihi illā bi-mā huwa min niʻamihi al-jammāʼ ..."
Secundo folio: naḥmaduhu subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá.
16.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 7.3 x 11.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 11 unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Umm al-Barāhīn" in red; extensive commentaries on the margins of the first 12 leaves; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn lil-muʼallif al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻumdah al-humām, al-ʻāmil al-ʻālim wa-al-quṭb al-wāṣil, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥasanī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-raḥimanā bi-hi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak yawm al-Thulāth al-mubārak, rābiʻ ʻashar yawman khalat min shahr Shaʻbān, sanat 1234, ʻalá yad kātibihi wa-mālikihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad Aḥmad Naʻīm al-Ṭaḥlāwī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī khirqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-ikhwānihi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-ghufrān al-dhanb wa-satr al-ʻayb, bi-mannika wa-karamika, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed commentary was concluded on blessed Tuesday, 14 Shaʻbān, 1234 [of the Hijrah = 8 June, 1819], by its copyist and owner, the poor and despised, Muḥammad Aḥmad Naʻīm al-Ṭaḥlāwī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī khirqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren, all Muslims, and him who invokes [God] to pardon his sin and cover his blemish, by Your benevolence and generosity, O Most Merciful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.

Secundo folio: jallat ʻan al-ʻadd wa-al-iḥṣāʼ.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 33 lines per page.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Umm al-Barāhīn" preceded by the letter Ṣ and the commentary by the letter Sh in red; markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; some wormholes with some loss of text; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn [Muḥammad Darwīsh] al-Abzārī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was copied on the twelfth day in the Sacred and blessed month of [Muḥarram?], the year 1147 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the poor who admits his disability and insufficiency, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Darwish al-Abzārī, al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.

notes.text: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tawaḥḥada fī dhātih, wa-tanazzaha ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ fī nuʻūtihi wa-simātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Ghanī al-Qadīr: Saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥa Allāh taʻālá lī wa-lahum al-ḥāl wa-al-shān, an aktuba kitābah bahīyah ʻalá al-muqaddimah al-mashhūrah bi-al-Sanūsīyah, fa-insharaḥ ṣadrī li-dhālik, wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-mā hunālik, li-annahā wa-in kānat ṣaghīrat al-jurm, kabīrat al-ʻilm, muḥtawiyah ʻalá jamīʻ al-ʻaqāʼid, maʻa ziyādat al-fawāʼid, wa-li-dhālika kānat aḥsan al-muʼallafāt fī al-tawḥīd, wa-akhlaṣahā min al-ḥashw wa-al-taʻqīd. Wa-hā anā ashraʻu fī al-maqṣūd bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-maʻbūd, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh taʻālá al-tawfīq. Qawluhu 'Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm' ..."
Secundo folio: bi-ḥaythu lā yakūnu muḥarraman.
17.7 x 23.4 cm; written surface: 12.8 x 19.3 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap (in 8 numbered quires).
In fair, large and clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-sharīf yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, tisʻah ʻashar yawm khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Thāni alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-iḥdá wa-sabʻūn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh tabāraka wa-taʻālá ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble book was copied on blessed Monday, 19 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1271 [of the Hijrah = 9 January, 1855]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. May God, the Blessed and Exalted, pray on our Master Muḥammad, and all his family and companions, as long as He is remembered by those who remember, and forgotten to be remembered by the forgetful."

May peace be upon the Messengers [of God]. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It was completed on blessed Monday, in Jumādá al-Awwal, of the year 1227 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [18 or 25 May, 1812], may the best prayer and the purest peace be upon him. May God forgive us, our parents, our masters, our brethren in God, Most High, the living among them and the dead, and all the Muslims. Amen. Amen."

Copyist's colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Thalāth, li-tisʻ wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1206 [1260], alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittīn, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá ʻafw al-Bārī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ʻĪsá al-Najjārī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslaimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Innaka qarīb mujīb al-daʻawāt, Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi, wa-ʻalá āl baytih, kullamā dhakaraka al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Tammat."

Translation of the copyist's colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah: "This noble copy was completed on Tuesday, 29 Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1260 [of the Hijrah = 16 July, 1844], by the poor to the forgiveness of the Creator, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ʻIsá al-Najjārī, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims, men and women, and all believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. [O God], You are close and fulfills the needs [of those who call upon You] O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and those of his household, whenever You are remembered by those who remember, and whenever He is not remembered by the forgetful. It is completed."

Colophon of Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, li-tisʻ wa-ʻishrīn khalat min Jumād al-Ākhir, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittīn, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá ʻafw al-Bārī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Najjārī. Allāhumma, Ighfir la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼmīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Innaka qarīb, mujīb al-daʻawāt. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd: "This copy was completed on blessed Tuesday, 29 Jumād al-Ākhir, 1260 [of the Hijrah = 16 July, 1844], by the poor to the forgiveness of the Creator, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Najjārī. O God! Forgive him, his parents and Muslim men and women, and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. You are close and fulfills the needs [of those who call upon You] O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Sharqāwī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-Sharqāwī.

notes.text: Title supplied by cataloger.

Fa-yaqūlu kathīr al-masāwī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-mashhūr bi-al-Sharqāwī: Qad ṭalab minnī baʻḍ al-ikhwān an aktuba ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī ʻalá Umm al-barāhīn, al-musammāh bi-al-Ṣughrá ..."

Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-sādah al-aʻlām, wa-sallam."

title: 880-02 Taqāyīd ʻalá Sharḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām al-Laqānī li-Jawhart wālidih : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.

notes.text: Title from Incipit.

Āmīn: Hādhihi taqāyīd ʻalá Sharḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām al-Laqānī li-Jawharat wālidih, arjū min faḍl Allāh taʻālá al-luṭf fīhā wa-al-shukr li-mūlīhā [li-muʼallifihā] ..."

May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, whenever he is remembered by those who remember and forgotten to be remembered by the forgetful."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth : manuscript / Dhū al-Nūn ibn Aḥmad.

notes.text: Title from folio 1a.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nazzala aḥsan al-ḥadīth hudan lil-muttaqīn, wa-bayyana bi-hi aṣwab al-ʻaqāʼid shirʻatan li-ahl al-yaqīn, wa-khaṣṣa min al-ʻibād man yashāʼu bi-raḥmatihi wa-istiqāmat al-dīn, wa-shayyada bunyān al-Islām wa-qawwá arkānahu bi-iqāmat al-ṣalāh fī al-ʻālamīn, wa-jaʻalahā farqan bayna al-ḥaqq wa-al-ḍalāl ilá Yawm al-Dīn, naḥmaduhu ʻalá mā razaqanā min tawātur ālāʼihi, wa-ʻalá al-rāsikhīn. Inna Allāh huwa al-razzāq, dhū al-qūwah al-matīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá nabīyihi al-ʻArabī, qudwat al-sālikīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-iswat al-sābiqīn Muḥammad.

Author's name from colophon.

Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥamdih, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, baqīyat al-mujtahidīn, Dhū al-Nūn ibn Aḥmad, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá [bi-hi] fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary is concluded by the help of God, Most High, and His praise, written by al-Shaykh al-Imām, the learned scholar, the remnant of the legists, Dhū al-Nūn ibn Aḥmad, may God benefit us through him in this world and the hereafter."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh [ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad]. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mutawaḥḥid bi-jalāl dhātih wa-kamāl ṣifātih, al-mutaqaddis [fī nuʻūt] al-jabarūt ʻan shawāyib al-naqṣ wa-simātih, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, al-muʼayyad bi-sāṭiʻ ḥujajihi wa-wāḍiḥ bayyinātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, hudāt ṭarīq al-ḥaqq wa-ḥumātih. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna mabná ʻilm al-sharāʼiʻ wa-al-aḥkām, wa-asās qawāʻid ʻaqāʼid al-Islām huwa ʻilm al-tawḥīd wa-al-ṣifāt, al-mawsūm bi-ʻilm al-kalām, al-munjī min ghayāhib al-shukūk wa-ẓulumāt al-awhām, wa-inna al-mukhtaṣar al-musammá bi-al-ʻAqāʼid, lil-Imām al-humām, qudwat ʻulamāʼ al-Islām, Najm al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, ʻUmar al-Nasafī, aʻlā Allāh darajatahu fī Dār al-Salām, yashtamilu min hādhā al-fann ʻalá ghurar al-fawāʼid wa-durar al-farāʼid ..."
Secundo folio: minhā mā yataʻallaqu bi-kayfīyat al-ʻamal.
14 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap, cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In fair and clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafī lil-Saʻd al-Taftāzānī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat al-faqīr ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥamādah al-Mardāwī. Sanat 1171 [of the Hijrah = 1757/1758]."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid lil-Taftāzānī ... ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 64a, after the colophon: A note by a reader/auditor (Shihāb al-Dīn ibn Aḥmad al-Dalḥamūnī), dated 10 Ramaḍan 1073 of the Hijrah (18 April, 1663), stating that he read the book with his teacher, al-Shaykh Sulṭān al-Mizāḥī, as follows: "Taḥammalahā kātib al-ḥurūf al-ḥaqīr Shihāb al-Dīn ibn Aḥmad al-Dalḥamūnī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Nuṣayrī kunyatan wa-laqaban, samāʻan min fam Shaykh al-ʻaṣr wa-al-zamān, nūr Allāh fī arḍih, Mawlānā wa-Sayyidinā, al-Shaykh Sulṭān al-Mizāḥī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, mattaʻa Allāh bi-wujūdihi al-anām, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī khatama Allāh bi-hi al-nubūwah wa-al-risālah khayra khitām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-tābiʻīhi, wa-ḥizbihi wa-ṣaḥābatihi ḥuamāt dīn al-Islām. Katabahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-ḥaqīr al-madhkūr, fī ʻā [ʻāshir] shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, aḥad shuhūr sanat 1073, rājiyan bi-dhālika mimman qaraʼahu, aw naẓara ilá shayʼ minhu an yadʻuwa bi-al-raḥmah la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn."

Colophon: "Najaz taḥrīr al-kitāb fī yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, khāmis ʻishrīn Jumādá al-Thānī, fī sanat 862 [... ...]. Wa-ʻallaqahu li-nafsihi al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed on blessed Friday, 25 Jumādá al-Thānī, 862 [... ... of the Hijrah = 19 May, 1458]. Copied by the despised Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī, for himself. May God forgive him and him who invokes [God] for his forgiveness."

title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.

notes.text: Title from from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa li-ahl al-Sunnah al-Muḥammadīyah fī al-khāfiqayn aʻlāman, wa-waḍaʻa bi-wāḍiḥ adillatihim min shubah al-mukhālifīn aʻlāman, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lahu, shahādatan takūnu bi-al-takhalluṣ fī al-dārayn iʻlāman, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mamnūḥ man ittabaʻahu fī al-jinān aʻlāman, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih mā ubbidat qawāʻid al-ʻaqāʼid wa-mā ḥulliyat al-jiyād bi-jawāhir al-farāʼid. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-fānī, ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Qad kuntu lakhkhaṣtu mā ʻallaqahu Ustādhunā min ʻUmdat al-murīd ʻalá ʻaqīdatihi al-musammāh bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd ..."
Secundo folio: fī al-jinān aʻlāman.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 6.7 x 13.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in 15 unnumbered quires)
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of Jawharat al-tawḥīd and markings in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhā 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharah al-tawḥīd' ..."
"Jawhart al-tawḥīd" starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ṣilātihi // thumma ṣalāt Allāh maʻa ṣalāmihi."
Leaf 153 is blank.

Author's colophon (folios 151b-152a): "Qāla kātibuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu al-ḥaqīr ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author and compiler, the despised ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on blessed Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [5 February, 1638], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful, He suffices me, He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Amen."

Owner/copyist's colophon: "Mulk al-faqīr al-dhalīl al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Muḥammad al-madʻū Shāfiʻī al-Bisāṭī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih."

Translation of the owner/copyist's colophon: "Owned by the poor and feeble, he who admits his inability and insufficiency, Muḥammad al-madʻū Shāfiʻī al-Bisāṭī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, and all Muslims. Amen, Amen, Amen, Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions."

title: 880-02 Fatḥ al-qarīb al-majīd bi-Sharḥ Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Barr ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ujhūrī.

notes.text: Title from from incipit (folio 1b)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ʻlayhi tawakkulī wa-iʻtimādī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala lanā ilayhi ṭarīqan wa-sabīlan, wa-aqāma lanā ʻalá maʻrifatihi burhānan wāḍiḥan wa-dalīlan, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan tamnaḥu qāʼilahā sharāban mizājuhu zanjabīlan, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, wa-ḥabībuhu wa-khalīluh, baʻathahu ilaynā muʻalliman wa-rasūlan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi bukratan wa-aṣlan [wa-aṣīlan]. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn al-Shaykh Sayf al-Dīn al-Ujhūrī al-Shāfiʻī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu: Qad kuntu sharaḥtu manẓūmat Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā wa-Shaykhinā al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī al-musammah bi-al-Jawharah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd sharḥan muṭawwalan, wa-qad suniḥa lī an akhtaṣirahu fī naḥw niṣf ḥajmihi, li-yashula al-tanāwul minhu ʻalá al-mubtadī, wa-lā yaqṣuru ʻan ifādat al-muntahī. Wa-ʻalá Allāh al-karīm iʻtimādī fīhi wa-fī ghayrihi min jamīʻ umūrī, dunyā wa-ukhrá, wa-ilayhi tafwīḍ [tafwīḍī] wa-isnādī. Wa-sammaytuhu Fatḥ al-qarīb al-majīd li-sharḥ Jawhart al-tawḥīd ..."
Secundo folio: wa-in kāna shiʻran li-annahu min baḥr al-rajaz.
15.5 x 22.2 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding (in 15 unnumbered quires)
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of Jawharat al-tawḥīd in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Jawharah, lil-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ʻālim al-humām, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Ujhūrī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Burhānī adaban. Wa-muʼallif al-Manẓūmah al-Laqānī. Raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-himā fī al-dārayn, wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."
On folio 1a: Five verses of poetry in which are mentioned the names of the major prophets who ought to be believed: "Asmāʼ al-anbiyāʼ al-aʻlām alladhīna yajibu al-īmān bihim tafṣīlan."

On folio 1a: A quotation from an unidentified source about the difference between two different kinds of God's attributes: "Ṣift al-dhāt" and "Ṣifat al-fiʻl" (Essence and Action attributes), as follows: "Iʻlam anna al-farq bayna ṣifat al-dhāt wa-ṣifat al-fiʻl anna kull ṣifah lā yūṣafu Allāh bi-ḍiddihā fa-hiya ṣifat dhāt, ka-al-qudrah, fa-lā yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā wa-hiya al-ʻajz, wa-al-ʻilm kadhālika lā yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā, wa-hiya al-jahl. Wa-inna kull ṣifah yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā, fa-hiya ṣiffat fiʻl, ka-la-hidāyah, fa-yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā, wa-huwa al-iḍlāl, wa-ka-al-riḍá, ḍidduhu al-sukhṭ. Intahá."
"Jawhart al-tawḥīd" starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ṣilātihi // thumma ṣalāt Allāh maʻa ṣalāmihi."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā awradahu al-Shaykh al-Imām, wa-al-ʻālim al-humām, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn al-Shaykh Sayf al-Dīn al-Ujhūrī baladan wa-masqaṭan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban wa-maḥtidan, al-Burhānī adaban, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻan wālidayhi wa-mashāyikhihi, wa-ʻan muʼallif hādhihi al-manẓūmah, al-ʻAllāmah al-Laqānī, wa-aqrānihi, wa-man yalūdhu bi-hi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taswīdihi fī Shawwāl, sanat 1236 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what was written by al-Shaykh al-Imām, the diligent scholar al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn al-Shaykh Sayf al-Dīn al-Ujhūrī baladan wa-masqaṭan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban wa-maḥtidan, al-Burhānī adaban, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, and the author of this poem, the learned scholar al-Laqānī, his colleagues, and his associates. Copied during the month of Shawwāl, the year 1236 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [July, 1821]."

title: 880-02 al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī.

notes.text: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá sayyid al-khalq Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. Qāla al-faqīr al-ḍaʻīf al-miskīn ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-rājī min karamihi an yunjiyahu min al-qawm al-ẓālimīn, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī al-Shāfiʻī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi fī shiddatah: Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh alladhī jaʻala al-duʻāʼ li-radd al-qaḍāʼ, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-Anbiyāʼ, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-atqiyāʼ al-aṣfiyāʼ, fa-inna hādhā 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn', wa-silāḥ al-muʼminīn min khizānat al-Nabī al-amīn, wa-al-haykal al-ʻaẓīm, min qawl al-Rasūl al-karīm, wa-al-ḥirz al-maknūn min lafẓ al-Maʻṣūm al-Maʼmūn ..."
Secundo folio: min sharr al-nās wa-al-jinnah.
13 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding.

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink on white paper; text fully vocalized; the abbreviations of the sources of the sited Ḥadīths in red; markings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn."
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi bi-khaṭṭ muʼallifihā, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

On strips of paper pasted to the back of the front and back covers: "Hādhihi al-nuskhah qad tasharrafat bi-anwār maṭlaʻat al-Amīr Ḥasab Allāh, shaqīq Sulṭān Darfūr, alladhī sarāy iqāmatihi amām shāriʻ al-Sayyidiah Fāṭimah al-Nabawīyah, wa-li-ḥubbihi fī nasl al-Ḥusayn qad tasharrafnā bi-al-muthūl baynā yadayhi, lammā amar aḥad al-ashrāf aḥbābih bi-an yuḥḍiranā ilá ḥaḍratihi, li-ʻilmihim bi-annanā narghabu al-kutub al-nafīsah, fa-lammā iṭṭalaʻa ʻalayhim ikhtāra hādhihi minhum, wa-an yuʻṭīnā qīmat al-rahn aḍʻāf, fa-lam naqbal. Fa-yā awlādanā, takūnū malʻūnīn idhā taṣarraftum fīhā bi-thiqlihā almās idhā lam yaḥḍur al-sanad, wa-tusallam li-aṣḥabihā [li-aṣḥābihā]. Wa-alladhī waṣṣalahā ilaynā huwa al-Sayyid Bakrī al-Ḥusaynī al-Dimashqī, zawj al-sitt bint ibn bint bint ibn al-muʼallif. Wa-aṣl al-rahn kāna ʻalá khamsat Junayhāt Ifrankī, wa-akhadha ʻalaynā sanad muḥarrar la-hu bi-khaṭṭinā, bi-anna hādhihi al-nuskhah al-dhākirīn ʻanhā bi-al-īṣāl, bi-annanā lā nusallimuhā illā la-hu, aw, man yuʼtaman ṣārifuhu, wa-yursiluhu maʻahu, wa-nastalim al-mablagh minhu. Wa-bi-khilāf dhālik lā yumkin al-taslīm li-aḥad, wa-lā yaṣuḥḥ bayʻuhā, wa-lā yarhunuhā li-aḥad qaṭṭ. Thumma fī yawm al-safar akhadha Junayh Ifrankī wa-qayyadahu bi-al-sanad ayḍan. Thumma fī al-miḥaṭṭah ishtará baʻḍ ashyāʼ tablugh thalāthah wa-thalāthūn Ghirsh Ṣāgh, wa-tawajjaha, wa-ṣāra la-hu muddah lam yaḥḍur. Wa-bi-al-istiʻlām ʻanhu, qīla lanā innahu tawajjaha bi-tijārat bilād al-Turk, ḥasaba ʻādatih, wa-lam yaḥḍur li-Dimashq min muddah. Wa-bi-al-iṭṭilāʻ ʻalá hādhihi al-nuskhah min al-sādah al-akābir, dufiʻa lanā fīhā ʻasharat Junayhāt. Fa-naẓaran li-kawnihā amānah wa-marhūnah, lā saḥamat [samaḥat] nafsī bi-dhālika qaṭṭ."

On folio 105b (in red color): A note from an owner (or borrower): "Hādhihi al-nuskhah qad istaḥwaztu ʻalayhā min warathat al-muʼallif, wa-ṣarafnā min ajlihā jumlat maṣārīf, fī al-hadāyā lahum, tazīdu ʻan al-sittimiʼat Qirsh, li-ajl al-tabarruk bi-khaṭṭ al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-bi-asrārih. Āmīn. al-Faqīr Ḥusayn ibn Rāshid al-Mashhadī al-Ḥanafī. 11 Rajab, sanat 1282 [30 November, 1865]."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ajall, ruḥalat ajillat al-ʻualamāʼ, wārith ʻulūm al-anbiyāʼ ... Mawlānā Shams al-Dīn, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī ... Faraghtu min taṣnīf hādhā 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn' yawm al-Aḥad baʻda al-ẓuhr, al-thānī wa-al-ʻishrīn min Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat iḥdá wa-tisʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah, bi-madrasatī allatī anshaʼtuhā bi-raʼs ʻAqabat al-Kattān, dākhil Dimashq al-maḥrūsah, ḥamāhā Allāh taʻālá min al-āfāt, wa-sāʼir bilād al-Muslimīn, hādhā, wa-jamīʻ Abwāb Dimashq mughlaqah, bal musaddah bi-al-aḥjār, wa-al-khalāʼiq yastaghīthūn ʻalá al-aswār, wa-al-nās fī juhd ʻaẓīm min al-ḥiṣār, wa-al-miyāh maqṭūʻah, wa-al-aydī ilá Allāh taʻālá bi-al-taḍarruʻ marfūʻah, wa-qad uḥriqa al-balad wa-nuhiba aktharuhu, wa-kull wāḥid khāʼif ʻalá nafsihi wa-ahlihi wa-mālih, wajilun min dhunūbihi wa-sūʼ aʻmālih, wa-qad taḥaṣṣana bi-mā yaqdiru ʻalayhi, fa-jaʻalatu hādhā al-Ḥiṣn ḥiṣnī, wa-tawakkaltu ʻalá Allāh wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-qad ajaztu awlādī Abā al-Fatḥ Muḥammadan, wa-Abā Bakr Aḥmad, wa-Abā al-Qāsim ʻAlīyan, wa-Abā al-Khayr Muḥammadn, wa-Fāṭimah, wa-ʻĀʼishah, wa-Salmá, wa-Khadījah, riwāyatahu sanadan ʻanī, maʻa mā yajūzu lī riwāyatuhu, wa-kadhālika ajaztu ahl ʻaṣrī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu, awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Sayyid al-khalq Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-salāmuh. Allāhumma ighfir li-muʼallifihi, wa-kātibihi, wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi, wa-li-man daʻā lahum, wa-li-sāʼir al-Muslimīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá āl Muḥammad, wa-aṣḥāb Muḥammad, wa-sallam. Ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Subḥāna man lā yaʻlamu qadrahu ghayruh, wa-lā yablughu al-wāṣifūn ṣifatah."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, the most esteemed, al-Shaykh al-Imam, to whom the most learned scholars journey, the inheritor of the knowledge of the Prophets, Mawlānā, Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī, said ... I finished authoring this book, titled 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn', on the afternoon of Sunday, 22 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 791 [of the Hijrah = 20 December, 1389], at my school which I built at the top of ʻAqabat al-Kattān [neighborhood], inside protected Damascus (May the Almighty God protect it from calamities, and all the lands of the Muslims), during the time when all the gates of Damascus were closed, rather, blocked by boulders, while all the people were calling [upon God] for help, above the walls, whilst in great agony, because of the siege. The waters were cut off, the hands lifted up in supplication to God Almighty. The city was burnt, and most of it plundered. While everyone was afraid for himself, his family and his possessions, scared of his sins and evil acts, having fortified himself with whatever he could, I made this Ḥiṣn ["Fortress", i.e., the book which he authored] my fortress, entrusting myself to God, who suffices me and is my best advocate. I have authorized my children: Abū al-Fatḥ Muḥammad, Abū Bakr Aḥmad, Abū al-Qāsim ʻAlī, Abū al-Khayr Muḥammad, Fāṭimah, ʻĀʼishah, Salmá, and Khadījah, to transmit this book on my behalf, in addition to all what I myself am authorized to transmit. I have also authorized my contemporary scholars to do the same. Praise be to God alone in the beginning and at the end. May His prayers and peace be upon Muḥammad, the Lord of the created beings, and upon his family and his companions. May God forgive the author of this book, its copyist, its reader, he who beseeches God to forgive them, and all Muslims. Praise be to God, May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the family of Muḥammad, the companions of Muḥammad, and Muslims. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There in no power nor might except in God, the All Mighty, the All Powerful. Praise be to Him who no one knows his might except Him, and to whom no one can describe His attributes."
Copyist's colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Tamm."
Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. It is completed."

title: 880-02 al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī.

notes.text: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá sayyid al-khalq Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. Qāla al-faqīr al-ḍaʻīf al-miskīn al-munqaṭiʻ ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-rājī min karamihi an yunjiyahu min al-qawm al-ẓālimīn, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī, laṭafa Allāh taʻālá bi-hi fī shiddatah: Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh alladhī jaʻala al-duʻāʼ sababan li-radd al-qaḍāʼ, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-Anbiyāʼ, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-atqiyāʼ al-aṣfiyāʼ, fa-inna hādhā 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn', wa-silāḥ al-muʼminīn min khizānat al-Nabī al-amīn, wa-al-haykal al-ʻaẓīm, min qawl al-Rasūl al-karīm, wa-al-ḥirz al-maknūn min lafẓ al-Maʻṣūm al-Maʼmūn badhaltu fīhi al-naṣīḥah, wa-akhrajtuhu min al-Aḥādīth al-ṣaḥīḥah ..."
Secundo folio: min kull ẓālim bi-mā ḥawá.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 13.5; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 10 unnumbered quires); red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the abbreviations of the sources of the sited Ḥadīths in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover and on folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn lil-ʻAllāmah al-Jazarī."
Folio 96 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah laylat al-Sabt al-mubārak, ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1220 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá raḥmat al-Rabb al-karīm, ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī mawlidan, al-Fayyūmī aṣlan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻAlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on the night of blessed Saturday, the 22 of blessed Ramaḍān, 1220 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [14 December, 1805], may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the poorest of the servants to the mercy of the generous Lord, al-Ujhūrī mawlidan, al-Fayyūmī aṣlan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, and the Muslims. Peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.

notes.text: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Allāhumma ṣallī [ṣalli] wa-sallim ʻalá man ashraf asmāʼihi Sayyidunā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."
Secundo folio: Aḥmad, Ḥāmid, Maḥmūd, Aḥyad.
8.2 x 11.2 cm; written surface: 5.2 x 8.7; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding, with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In clear naskh script, in black ink on white paper; names of God and the Prophet Muḥammad in red; some headings and markings in red; on folios 7b and 8a are the representations of two chambers, decorated in red and blue, with lamps, two minarets and headstones of three tombs; catchwords.
Folios 107-110 are blank.

Colophon: "Qad tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah laylat al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah, sittah khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1264, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtari[f] bi-al-dhunūb wa-al-taqṣīr ilá Mawlāhu al-farḍ [al-fard] al-ṣamad, ʻabduhu Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Manīs, al-Muṭawwibī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Burhānī al-Shādhilī ṭarīqan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on the night of blessed Friday, 6 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1264 [of the Hijrah = 11 February, 1848], by the poor and despised, who confesses his sins and admits his deficiency to his Lord, the Peerless and the Everlasting, His servant, Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Ḥajj ʻAlī Manīs, al-Muṭawwibī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Burhānī al-Shādhilī ṭarīqan, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen."

title: 880-02 Kawkab al-mabānī wa-mawkib al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī.

notes.text: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf, wa-sarḥ li-ṭayf al-khayāl al-muṭīf, kashafa bi-hi ʻAbd al-Ghanī ʻammā taḍammanahu al-matn min kull maʻnan sanī, wa-sirrun bi-hi jāmiʻuhu muʻtanī. Kayfa, wa-jāmiʻuhu, al-jāmiʻ al-fāriq, al-ʻālim al-mashhūr fī al-maghārib wa-al-mashāriq, al-ʻārif al-Rabbānī wa-al-haykal al-ṣamadānī, Janāb Abī Ṣāliḥ, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī, Shaykhunā ijāzatan wa-ʻahdan, wa-ubūwatan rūḥānīyah, muḥāḍanatan wa-mahdan, saqá Allāh taʻālá sāḥat qalbihi saḥāʼib al-madad al-dāʼim min samāwāt qurbihi, wa-qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu ... Alā wa-inna al-matn huwa kitāb al-Ṣalawāt al-Muḥammadīyah wa-al-taslīmāt al-mubārakāt al-Aḥmadīyah ... wa-laqad salaktu fīhā maslak al-ikhtiṣār, fa-inna ẓulmat hādhā al-waqt lā taḥtamilu ishrāq hādhihi al-anwār ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Kawkab al-mabānī wa-markab al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī' ..."
Secundo folio: athar asmāʼihi wa-ṣifātih.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the "Ṣalawāt" of al-Jīlānī in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Kawkab al-mabānī wa-mawkib al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn, taʼlīf Shaykhinā al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-humām, al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, man huwa malḥūẓ bi-alṭāf Rabbihi al-muḥṣī, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Tamm."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr ʻAẓm Zādah, Wajīh al-Muʼayyad ibn al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Muʼayyad, fī 6 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1206 [3 November, 1791]."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Kawkab al-mabānī wa-mawkib al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī' ..."
Between folios 53b and 54a is an insert, in a different hand, quoting commentaries from different authors on the Ḥadīth "Anā dār al-ḥikmah wa-ʻAlī bābuhā".
Folios 65-68 are blank.

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Wa-qad ittafaqa al-farāgh min taʼlīf hādhā al-kitāb ʻashīyat yawm al-Jumʻah, al-tāsiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min Shaʻbān, sanat sabʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."
Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: 'This book was completed on Friday evening, 29 Shaʻbān, 1127 [of the Hijrah = 30 August, 1715]."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak, ittifāqan, ʻashīyat yawm al-Jumʻah, al-tāsiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min Rabīʻ al-Awwal, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat sittah wa-sittūn wa-miʼah <wa-miʼah> wa-alf, bi-khaṭṭ al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh al-Qadīr, ʻAlī ibn Bakrī Darwīsh, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist colophon: "This blessed book was copied, coincidentally, on Friday evening, 29 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1166 [of the Hijrah = 3 February, 1753], in the handwriting of the poor to his Almighty Lord, ʻAlī ibn Bakrī Darwīsh, may God forgive him, his parents, him who reads it, him, who, invokes God to forgive him [the copyist], and all the Muslims. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 Ṣalawāt ʻalá al-Nabī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.

notes.text: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-qawī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mujīrī al-Mullawī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Raḥīm al-Ghaffār, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-mukhtār, wa-ʻalá sāʼir al-nabīyīn, wa-ālihim wa-aṣḥābihim al-akhyār al-abrār, wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi Ṣalawāt ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh [ʻalayhi] wa-sallam, jalīlat al-miqdār, asʼalu Allāh an yarzuqanī wa-kull man iʻtaná bi-hā al-ikhlāṣ wa-mazīd al-istibṣār ..."
Secundo folio: fī amrī. al-Ṣalāh al-thālithah.
14.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Wa-hādhihi Risālah fī ṣiyagh [ṣalawāt] ʻan [ʻalá] al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-muḥaqqiq, imām waqtihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Mullawī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tammat al-risālah bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá, wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The epistle was completed by the praise of God Almighty, His help and His abundant benevolence, thoroughly and perfectly. Praise be to God in all circumstances. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen."

title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.

notes.text: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dārayn. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-faḍāʼilihā, adhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-kitāb 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad al-mukhtār', ibtighāʼ marḍāt Allāh taʻālá, wa-maḥabbatan fī Rasūlihi al-karīm, Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."
Secundo folio: Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.
16.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding, with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frame.
In beautiful and large naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins; some collations with other copies; text within double red frames; catchwords.

On the preliminary page: An ownership statement: "Qad dakhala hādhā al-kitāb, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, fī mulk al-faqīr, Dhikr al-Jalālah, Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Masʻūd Abū Ghazālah, ʻafá Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu. Āmīn. Sanat 1206 [1791/1792]."
On the verso of the preliminary page, in a different handwriting: "Tārīkh al-Aʼimmah al-arbaʻah, [wa] tārīkh al-aqṭāb al-arbaʻah ... manẓūmah wa-maḥsūbah bi-ḥisāb al-jummal."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, lil-Imām al-Jazūlī."
On folio 1a: Two illegible ownership statements.

On folio 90b: A reader's note: "Khutimat hādhihi al-nuskhah qirāʼatan thalāthamiʼat marrah, muddat shahrayn, ḥāla kawnihā ʻāriyah ʻindī. Ḥarrarahu al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad al-Ṣādiq al-Taqawī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-raḥim. Wa-ʻalá Allāh al-qabūl."

On folios 91b-92b: A prayer attributed to Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Badawī and a reader's note about it: "... wa-ajāzanī bi-hā al-Sayyid al-Sharīf Sayyidī al-Ḥājj Mujāhid al-Nawasānī ʻan Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Badawī ..."

Allāhumma infaʻ bi-hi mālikahu, wa-kātibahu, wa-muṭāliʻahu, wa-al-nāẓira fīhi, wa-infaʻ bi-hi wālidayhim, wa-mashāyikhahum, wa-man daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah, wa-alṭif bi-him. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá khayr khalqih, Muḥammad Nabīyih, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih, wa-sallim taslīman kathīran."

Copied on Thursday, 29 Jumādá al-Ākhir, 714 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [18 October, 1314]. May God pray on Muḥammad, a prayer that encompasses all the blesses and blessings, and continues to be upon him, the length of Your existence. You who possesses majesty and honor. May it also encompass those who are shadowed under his banner, and join the religion of God through his door, as did the prophets, the messengers, the closest angels, his virtuous wives, mothers of the faithful, his companions, and all his followers, let it be as much as Your knowledge encompasses, Your pen registers, Your verdict dictates, and Your Book calculates. O You who bestows the greatest favors. O God. Benefit with it its owner, its copyist, its reader, he who looks into it, and benefit also their parents, their masters, and he who invokes God to forgive them and have mercy upon them. Amen. Amen. Amen. And all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May His prayers be upon the best of His creation, Muḥammad, His prophet, his family and his companions, and grant them abundant peace."

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink on white paper; some words and phrases in red; the phrases are separated with decorative circles in gold; the opening two pages are decorated in purple, gold, orange and blue; text fully vocalized, with double frames in gold and black; folios 14b and 15a were left blank, to be filled with the representation of "al-Ḥujrah al-Muṭahharah wa-al-Qubūr al-Thalāthah" (the Sanctified Chamber and the Three Tombs); catchwords.
On the margin of folio 1b: "Qāla al-Shaykh al-taqī Abū ʻAbd Allāh Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh."

On the margin of folio 68b: An invocation by a reader: "Allāhumma an taghfir li-ʻabdika Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Badrī, al-khāṭiʼ al-ḍaʻīf. Āmiīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Bi-raḥmatika. Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-nasʼaluka Allāhumma, bi-nūr wajhika alladhī malaʼa arkān ʻarshika an tazraʻa fī qalbī maʻrifataka, ḥattá aʻrifuka ḥaqqa maʻrifatika, kamā yanbaghī an tuʻrafa bi-hi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, khātim al-nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-01 Taʻlīqāt ʻalá Sharḥ Faḍāʼil Ramaḍān : manuscript.

notes.text: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. 'Yā ayyuhā alladhīn āmanū kutiba ʻalaykum al-ṣiyām'. Atá bi-Yāʼ al-nidāʼ al-mawḍūʻah li-nidāʼ al-baʻīd, wa-in kāna al-munādá qarīban, idh qad tustaʻmalu fīhi li-tanzīlihi manzilat al-baʻīd lil-iʻtināʼ bi-al-madʻw la-hu wa-ziyādat al-ḥathth ʻalayhi. Wa-qāla al-Bayḍāwī ʻinda qawlihi: 'Yā ayyuhā al-nās uʻbudū rabbakum', mā naṣṣuhu: Wa-yā ḥarf wuḍiʻa li-nidāʼ al-baʻīd, wa-qad yunādá bi-hi al-qarīb tanzīlan la-hu manzilat al-baʻīd'. 'Immā' li-ʻaẓamatihi, ka-qawl al-dāʻī 'Yā Rabb wa-Yā Allāh', wa-Huwa aqrab ilayhi min ḥabl al-warīd, wa-lighaflatihi wa-sūʼ fahmih, aw lil-iʻtināʼ bi-al-madʻw la-hu wa-ziyādat al-ḥathth ʻalayhi. Intahá ..."
Secundo folio: li-shayʼ minhu tanzīlan la-hu.
15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in 10 numbered quires).
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; markings and the commented-upon phrases of the original work in red; catchwords.

At the head of folio 1a: A verse of poetry by a reader, intended to date the year of a certain month of Ramaḍān in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (alphabetical reckoning), as follows: "Qudūmu khayrin wa-al-ṣiyāmu muqbilun // arrikhūhu Ramaḍānun (1091) zākī (38)." Probably the year 1129 of the Hijrah (August/September, 1717)."

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Faḍāʼil Ramaḍān lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn wa-ʻumdat al-ṭālibīn, Abī al-Irshād ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
On folio 1a: A crossed out phrase: "Wa-fīhi ayḍan 'Faḍāʼil ʻĀshūrāʼ' lil-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."
On folio 1a: A quotation attributed to ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib about 'Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ' in the month of Ramaḍān, and a commentary on it.
On folio 94b, at the end of the colophon: A collation note: "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá qadr al-ṭāqah."
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih.
Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. The book was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence."

title: 880-02 Munyat al-muṣallī wa-ghunyat al-mubtadiʼ : manuscript / Sadīd al-Dīn al-Kāshgharī.

notes.text: Title from inipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad, khātim al-nabīyīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn. Iʻlamū waffaqakum Allāh wa-īyānā inna anwāʻ al-ʻulūm kathīrah, wa-ahamm al-anwāʻ bi-al-taḥṣīl masāʼil al-ṣalāh. Fa-lammā raʼytu raghbat al-muqtabisīn fī taḥṣīlihā, iltaqaṭtu mā kathura wuqūʻuhu, wa-mimmā lā budda lahum minhu min muṣannafāt al-mutaqaddimīn wa-min mukhtārāt al-mutʼakhkhirīn, naḥwa al-Hidāyah, wa-al-Muḥīṭ, wa-Sharḥ al-Asbījābī [?], wa-al-Ghunyah, wa-al-Multaqaṭ, wa-al-Dhakhīrah, wa-Fatāwá Qāḍī Khān, wa-Jāmiʻayhi. Wa-sammaytuhu 'Munyat al-muṣallī wa-ghunyat al-mubtadī'. Asʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yajʻala mā iʻtamadtuhu khāliṣan li-wajh Allāh wa-mukaffiran li-dhunūbī bi-faḍlihi wa-raḥmatih ..."
Secundo folio: wa-minhu al-hidāyah wa-al-rashād.
13 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 15.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Matn Munyat al-muṣallī."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb sanat 1039."
Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed in the year 1039 [of the Hijrah = 1629 or 1630]."

title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.

notes.text: Title of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" from incipit (folio 8a).
Title of "al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah" from folio 70a.
Title of al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd hādhā, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-faḍāʼilihā, ndhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kitāb 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār', ibtighāʼan li-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá, wa-maḥabbatan fī Rasūlihi al-karīm, Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallama taslīman ..."
Secundo folio of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt": yawm al-Jumʻah wa-qāl.

Incipit of "al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah" "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala nawʻ al-insān akmal al-anwāʻ, wa-mayyazahu bi-al-nuṭq wa-al-idrāk wa-al-ikhtirāʻ, wa-jaʻala ṣiḥḥat badanihi wa-ʻaqlihi sababan li-wujūd al-intifāʻ, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī iʻtadala fī al-jism wa-al-ikhtilāq wa-al-ṭibāʻ, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-atbāʻ. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā muʼallaf laṭīf lā yaḥmiluhu al-insān, wa-lā yaḥtāju fī maʻrifatihi ilá aʻwān, wa-qad jamaʻa mā tafarraqa fī ghayrihi min al-taṣānīf, wa-aghná ʻan murājaʻat mā siwāhu min al-taʼālīf, jaʻalahu Allāh khāliṣan li-wajhihi, innahu qarībun qadīr, wa-bi-al-ijābah li-man daʻāhu jadīr ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah": wa-Allāh aʻlam. al-Awwal fī maʻrifat.

Incipit of al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah: "Qāla al-Mawlá al-Shaykh al-Imām, Sirāj al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Muḥammad ibn al-Rashīd al-Sajāwandī, nawwara Allāh marqadahu baʻdamā tayammana bi-al-basmalah: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ḥamda al-shākirīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: 'Taʻallamū al-farāʼiḍ wa-ʻallimūhā al-nās fa-innahā niṣf al-ʻilm'. Hākadhā riwāyat al-fuqahāʼ. Wa-al-farāʼiḍ, jamʻ farīḍah, wa-hiya mā quddira min al-sihām fī al-mīrāth. Wa-innamā jaʻala al-ʻilm bi-hā niṣf al-ʻilm, immā li-ikhtiṣāṣihā bi-iḥdá ḥālatay al-insān, wa-hiya al-mamāt, dūna sāʼir al-ʻulūm al-dīnīyah, fa-innahā mukhtaṣṣah bi-al-ḥayāh ..."
Secundo folio of al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah: al-ihtimām wa-lā yabʻud an yajʻala.
15-17 cm x 20-22 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In light brown leather binding, with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

Dalāʼil al-Khayrāt is in good naskh script; al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah is in good naskh/ruqʻah script; al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah is in beautiful naskh script; the three manuscripts are written in black ink, on white paper; some headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the preliminary page: "Hādhihi Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-aḥzāb ʻalá al-tamām."
On folio 1a: The family tree of al-Jazūlī, the author of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt", an index of contents of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt", and miscellaneous invocations.
On folios 1b-2a: Miscellaneous poems and invocations.

On folios 2b-7b: "Hādhā jadwal yudhkaru fīhi rawīn [ruwāt] al-Aḥādīth al-madhkūrah fī dībājat 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt', wa-asmāʼ al-ṣalawāt al-madhkūrah fīhā ʻalá tartīb al-Shaykh al-fāḍil, al-kāmil, al-ʻālim fī ʻilm al-ẓāhir wa-al-bāṭin, al-Shaykh Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn ibn Muṣṭafá, min ṭarīqat [al-ṭarīqah] al-ʻalīyah al-Naqshabandīyah al-Khālidīyah, al-mashhūr bi-al-Kamshakhānahwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātih. Āmīn."
On folios 50a-5b: List of conditions and etiquettes on how to read/recite the text of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt".
On folios 51a-68a: Miscellaneous prayers and invocations.
Folios 68b-69b are blank.
On folio 70a: "Hādhā al-juzw fī ʻilm al-ṭibb. Sanat 49."
On folio 70a, in pencil: "al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah."
On folio 70b: Definitions of various materia medica.
On folio 71a: "Hādhā kitāb fī ʻilm al-ṭibb, ʻalá al-tamām."

At the end of folio 118b, on the right of the colophon of "al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah": A note which indicates that this manuscript might have been used as a copy for an unidentified printed edition, dated 17 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1276 of the Hijrah (6 June, 1860): "Tamma ṭabʻan fī 17 al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1276, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-muḥtāj ilá fayḍ Rabbihi al-mutazāyid, ʻAlī Zāyid, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."
Folios 119a-120b are blank.
On folios 121a-122a: Quotations and poems from different sources.

Colophon of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Khātim al-nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. M."

Translation of the colophon of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, Seal of the Prophets, and the leader of the messengers, and on his family and companions, and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. M."
Colophon of al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon of al-Fawāʼid al-ṭibbīyah: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and companions, and grant them peace."
Colophon of al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah: "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Tārīkh 978."
Translation of the colophon of al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah: "It is completed by the help of God the Generously Giving King. Dated 978 [of the Hijrah = 1570/1571]."

title: 880-02 Ghāyat al-maqṣūd li-man yataʻāṭá al-ʻuqūd : manuscript / Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar al-Dayrabī al-Shāfiʻī.

notes.text: Title from folio 3a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ḥarrama al-sifāḥ wa-aḥalla al-nikāḥ lil-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm, wa-bayyana al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām min al-nisāʼ, ʻalá lisān man arsalahu raḥmatan lil-anām. Aḥmaduhu, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, ʻalá mā manaḥanā min al-anʻām, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, al-Malik al-ʻallām. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabdahu wa-rasūlah ashraf al-anām, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn bilā infiṣām. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Aḥmad al-Dayrabī al-Shāfiʻī al-Ghunaymī: Qad saʼalanī wālidī wa-baʻḍ al-ikhwān min al-anām, aḥsana Allāh lī wa-lahum ka-al-mabdaʼ al-khitām an aktuba shayʼan min al-masāʼil al-sharīʻah [al-sharʻīyah] al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-nikāḥ ʻalá madhhab al-Shāfiʻī wa-Abī Ḥanīfah, fa-ajabtuhum ilá dhālik ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ḥaythu dhakartu masʼalah.
15.5 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Marātib iqlīm Miṣr fī al-qaḍāʼ min ṭaraf al-salṭanah min Qāḍī ʻAskar Anāṭūlī."

On folio 1a: A reader's anecdote about the death of al-Dayrabī, as follows: "Wa-fī yawm al-Ithnayn, sādis ʻishrīn shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, sanat khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf [Monday, 17 March, 1738], warada al-khabar al-ṣaḥīḥ bi-intiqāl al-muʼallif al-mushār ilayhi ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá, fī yawm al-Ithnayn, tāsiʻ ʻashar shahr tārīkhih [Monday, 10 March, 1738], wa-ḥaḍara Mawlānā al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Ḥālī, Shaykh al-iftāʼ wa-al-tadrīs bi-madīnat al-Manṣūrah, wa-ṭalaba al-idhn min mawlāh, Muṣṭafá Afandī Zādah, Qāḍī al-Manṣūrah waqtaʼidhin, fī al-tawqīt li-wafātih, ʻalá al-manārāt, bi-al-Manṣūrah, iẓhāran li-shaʻāʼir al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻulamāʼ, wa-adhina bi-dhālik, wa-waqqata la-hu ʻalá al-manārāt wa-bi-al-ṣalāh ʻalayhi bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Kabīr al-Ṣāliḥī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmih fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-raḥimanā idhā ʻudnā ilayhi. Āmīn." "Thumma ẓahar wa-ittaḍaḥ annahu ʻalá qayd al-ḥayāh, abqāhu Allāh wa-nafaʻa bi-hi al-Muslimīn. Thumma māta fī al-sanah al-thāniyah. Wa-al-dawām wa-al-baqāʼ lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."
On folio 1b: Miscellaneous fatwás and poems.

On folio 2a: "Kitāb Ghāyat al-maqṣūd li-man yataʻāṭá al-ʻuqūd ʻalá madhāhib al-Aʼimmah al-arbaʻah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ḥabr al-humām, Shihāb al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, mawlā [Mawlānā] al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Dayrabī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 2a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu Ghāyat al-maqṣūd li-man yataʻāṭá al-ʻuqūd."
On folio 60b: A sample of "khutbat nikāḥ" (sermon for a prenuptial agreement) and a sample of "maḥḍar ʻaqd nikāḥ" (report of a marriage contract).

Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min itmāmih yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, thāmin ʻishrīn Ṣafar al-khayr, sanat thalāthah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah baʻda al-alf. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradtu īrādah fī hādhā al-muʼallaf. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hādhā. Wa-asʼalu Allāh an yajʻlahu khāliṣan li-wajhihi, bi-jāh Muḥammad ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The book was completed on blessed Friday, 28 Ṣafar, 1123 [of the Hijrah = 17 April, 1711]. This is the end of what I wanted to introduce in this work. Praise be to God who guided us to this. I implore God to render it solely for His own sake, through the intercession of Muḥammad, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon him."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá ʻafw Rabbihi wa-ghufrānih, al-faqīr ʻAlī ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, al-khādim bi-Jāmiʻ Rayḥān, fī ʻāshir shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sabʻah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. Ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was completed by the poorest of servants and the neediest to the forgiveness and pardon of his Lord, the poor ʻAlī ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, al-khādim bi-Jāmiʻ Rayḥān, on 10 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1127 [of the Hijrah = 15 April, 1715]. May God forgive him, his parents, his teachers, and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions and grant them abundat and continuous peace until Judgement Day."

title: 880-01 al-ʻIqd al-nafīs wa-nuzhat al-jalīs : manuscript.

notes.text: Title of al-ʻIqd al-nafīs wa-nuzhat al-jalīs from folio 2b
Title of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azhār from folio 35b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-ʻIqd al-nafīs wa-nuzhat al-jalīs: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻAlī al-Kabīr, al-qawī al-qadīr, al-ʻalīm al-khabīr, al-samīʻ al-baṣīr, munshiʼ kull shayʼ wa-mubdīy, wa-mubdī kull ḥayy wa-muʻīdih, wa-mubdiʻ kull makān wa-mūjidih, wa-muḥdith kull mawjūd wa-munqidhih, fa-lā taḥwīhi al-amkinah wa-al-aqṭār, wa-lā tublīhi al-azminah wa-al-adwār, wa-lā tudrikuhu al-ʻuyūn wa-al-abṣār, wa-lā yughayyiruhu al-layl wa-al-nahār ..."
Secundo folio of al-ʻIqd al-nafīs wa-nuzhat al-jalīs: ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.

Incipit of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azhār: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-baʻīd fī qurbih, al-qarīb fī buʻdih, al-mutaʻālī fī jiddihi ʻan hazal al-qawl wa-ḥaddih, al-muqaddas fī rafīʻ majdih, alladhī awjada mā kāna ʻadaman, wa-awdaʻa fī kull mawjūd ḥikaman, wa-jaʻala al-ʻaql bayna dhālika ḥakaman, li-yumayyiza al-shayʼ wa-ḍiddah ..."
Secundo folio of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azhār: wa-maddihi wa-taʼawwaha lahafan ʻalá lamaʻān al-barq.
10.4 x 17 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 11 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

The codex is written in the same hand, in beautiful naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; the head of folio 1b is decorated with a design in black, red and green; texts fully vocalized; no corrections and notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azhār."
On folio 1a: The birthdates of children (boys and girls), ranging from Thursday, 27 Muḥarram, 1175 to 2 Jumadá al-Ūlaá, 1202 (28 August, 1761 to 9 February, 1788).
On folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhu al-ʻIqd al-nafīs wa-nuzhat al-jalīs ..."
On folio 35: "... wa-sammaytuhu: Kitāb Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azhār ..."
On folio 75b: Five verses of poetry in Arabic and an invocation in Ottoman Turkish.
Colophon of al-ʻIqd al-nafīs wa-nuzhat al-jalīs: "Qad tammat al-ḥikam biʻawn Allāh taʻālá."
Translation of the colophon of al-ʻIqd al-nafīs wa-nuzhat al-jalīs: "The maxims are completed by the help of God Most High.

Colophon of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azhār: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak ākhir shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat 1156, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-Ḥājj Yāsīn al-ʻAjlūnī, ghafara Allāh dhunūbahu wa-satara ʻuyūbah, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azhār: "This blessed book was copied at the end of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1156 [of the Hijrah = 14 February, 1744], by the poor servant al-Ḥājj Yāsīn al-ʻAjlūnī, may God forgive his sins and cover his shortcomings, and all Muslims. Amen."

title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Munyat al-muṣallī wa-ghunyat al-mubtadī : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.

notes.text: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-ʻibādah maftaḥ al-saʻādah wa-maṭmaḥ al-siyādah wa-malmaḥ al-ḥusná wa-al-ziyādah, wa-jaʻala al-ṣalāh ʻamūd qiyāmihā wa-zarwat [wa-dharwat] sanāmihā wa-ʻumdat aḥkāmihā. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá afḍal khalqihi, Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī juʻilat fī al-ṣalāh qurrat ʻaynihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna fāzū min maʻdin al-dīn bi-lujaynihi wa-ʻaynih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá Rabbihi al-ghanī, Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī: Qad kuntu sharaḥtu kitāb Munyat al-muṣallī sharḥan, wa-sammaytuhu bi-Ghunyat al-mutamallī, lākin raʼaytu fīhi baʻḍ al-iṭālah allatī awjabat lil-mubtadiʼīn wa-al-qāṣirīn al-malālah, fa-ajibu [fa-aḥbabtu] an akhtaṣira min farāʼid dalāʼilihi, wa-azīda fī fawāʼid masāʼilihi, tasʹhīlan lil-ṭālibīn, wa-tanwīlan lil-rāghibīn. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá huwa al-mustaʻān ʻalá kull murād. Minhu al-mabdaʼ wa-ilayhi al-maʻād. Wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl."
Secundo folio: wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Qāla al-muṣannif.
14 x 22 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap; cover embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative designs.
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Munyat al-muṣallī wa-ghunyat al-muqrī."
On folio 1a: "Rabbi yassir. Yā ḥāfiẓ. Yā Kubaykij."
On folio 1a: "Sanat 1187 [of the Hijrah = 1773/1774]. Mullā Ibrāhīm ibn Muṣṭafá."
On folio 262b: A reader's date: "Sanat 1184 [1770/1771]."

Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh Malik [al-Malik] al-Wahhāb. Kataba [katabahu] al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Ṣāliḥ ibn Walī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, al-muḥtāj ilá Rabbihi al-ghanī, fī yawm al-Jumʻah, fī waqt al-ʻaṣr, fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, fī sanat. Raḥima Allāh li-man [man] yadʻū kātibahu [li-kātibihi] al-ḥaqīr wa-kathīr al-futūr. 1074 sanah Hijrīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of God, the Generously Giving King. Copied by the poor and despised Ṣāliḥ ibn Walī -- may God forgive him and his parents, and treat them and him with favor, he who is in need of his rich Lord -- on the afternoon of Friday, in the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, in the year [?]. May God have mercy upon him who invokes Him to have mercy upon the despised and full of slackness, its copyist. [Dated in] the year 1074 of the Hijrah [1663]."

title: 880-02 Itmām al-dirāyah li-qurrāʼ al-Nuqāyah : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.

notes.text: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá niʻamihi al-sābighah al-shāmilah, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan bi-al-najāh min al-aḥwāl kāfilah. Wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, dhū al-awṣāf al-jamīlah al-kāmilah, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man nāṣarahu wa-khālalah. Wa-baʻd, falammā ẓahar lī taṣwīb al-muliḥḥīn ʻalayya fī waḍʻ sharḥ ʻalá al-kurrāsah allatī sammaytuhā bi-al-Nuqāyah, wa-ḍammantuhā arbaʻata ʻashara ʻilman, wa-rāʻaytu fīhā ghāyat al-ījāz wa-al-ikhtiṣār, wa-awdaʻtu fī ṭayy alfāẓihā mā nasharahu al-nās fī al-kutub al-kibār, bi-ḥaythu lā yaḥtāju al-ṭālib ilá ghayrihā, wa-lā yuḥramu al-faṭin al-mutasāʼil li-daqāʼiqihā min khayrihā, bādartu ilá dhālika li-ʻumūm al-ʻāʼidah, wa-tamām al-fāʼidah, wa-ibrāzan li-mā anā bi-istikhrājihi aḥrá, idh ṣāḥib al-bayt adrá bi-mā fīhi. Wa-sammaytuhu 'Itmām al-dirāyah li-qurrāʼ al-Nuqāyah'. Wa-Allāh asʼalu al-tawfīq wa-al-hidāyah wa-al-riʻāyah ..."
Secundo folio: fa-dhāka ḥarām bi-ijmāʻ al-salaf.
14.7 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.3 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; brown leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Nuqāyah in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; many wormholes, mostly on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Itmām al-dirāyah li-qurrāʼ al-Nuqāyah, lil-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ḥabr al-humām, khātimat al-ḥuffāẓ, Jalāl al-Dīn al-Usyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu, wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-kitāb al-madhkūr, fīhi arbaʻata ʻashara ʻilman: ʻIlm uṣūl al-dīn, ʻilm al-tafsīr, ʻilm uṣūl al-fiqh, ʻilm al-farāʼiḍ, ʻilm al-naḥw, ʻilm al-taṣrīf, ʻilm al-khaṭṭ, ʻilm al-maʻānī, ʻilm al-bayān, ʻilm al-badīʻ, ʻilm al-tashrīḥ, ʻilm al-ṭibb, ʻilm al-taṣawwuf. Tammat."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: "Min niʻam Allāh ʻalá ʻabdihi ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Dāwūd, ghafara Allāh dhanbahu wa-satara ʻaybahu. Āmīn. Sanat 980 [1572/1573]."al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Intaqala bi-al-shirāʼ al-ṣaḥīḥ ilá dhimmat al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, man huwa muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad al-Ḥanafī al-Naqqāqī [?] al-Tawṣawī [?], ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu, sanat [...]." "Intaqala bi-al-shirāʼ ilá al-faqīr Qāsim al-Ghuṣayn."
On folio 89a: A reader's statement: "Ṭālaʻa fīhi al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Abū al-Surūr ibn ʻAbd al-Nabī al-Hūnī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻufiaya ʻanhu."
On folios 89b-90b: Miscellaneous invocations.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, al-thāmin ʻashar min shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ ʻām sanat 977. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-qad faragha minhu muʼallifuhu, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi, wa-jazāhu Allāh khayran, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihi wa-barakātihi. Āmīn. Yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, thālith Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 803 [873]."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on blessed Sunday, the eighteenth of God's sacred month, al-Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 977 [of the Hijrah = 13 July, 1569]. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. Its author -- May the mercy of God Almighty be upon him, and may God reward him favorably, and may He benefit us with his sciences and his blessings. Amen -- finished writing it on Tuesday, 3 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, the year 803 [i.e. 873 of the Hijrah = 30 September, 1468]."

title: 880-02 Taqrīb al-fawāʼid wa-tasʹhīl al-maqāṣid : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻAṭīyah al-Ḥamawī.

notes.text: Title from the author's colophon (folio 47b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Rabbi ishraḥ lī ṣadrī, wa-yassir lī amrī, wa-iḥlil ʻuqdatan min lisānī yafqahū qawlī. Rabbanā ātinā min ladunika raḥmatan, wa-hayyiʼ lanā min amrinā rashadan. Rabbi zidnī ʻilaman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, muqarrib al-baʻīd wa-musahhil al-shadīd, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Khātim al-Rusul, wa-sayyid al-ʻabīd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-jamīʻ ʻibād Allāh min kull barrin rashīd, ṣalātan tūjibu li-qāʼilihā ladhdhat al-naẓar ilá wajh Allāh al-karīm yawm al-waʻīd. Ammā baʻd, faqad iltamasa minnī baʻḍ aṣdiqāʼī an akhtaṣira kitābanā 'Miṣbāḥ al-hidāyah wa-miftāḥ al-wilāyah', fa-raʼaytu anna fī dhālika khayran, in shāʼa Allāh, fa-ajabtuhu. Wa-min Allāh astamiddu al-tawfīq, wa-iyyāhu asʼalu al-hidāyah ilá sawāʼ al-ṭarīq, wa-aljaʼu ilayhi an yanfaʻafnī bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn fī al-dārayn, wa-an yajʻalanā wa-sāʼir al-aḥibbah min khayr al-farīqayn ..."
Secundo folio: bi-hi nahy wa-lā ḍarar.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Taqrīb al-fawāʼid wa-tasʹhīl al-maqāṣid, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-nāsik al-ʻābid, al-wariʻ al-zāhid, al-ʻāmil al-fāḍil, qudwat al-sālikīn, wa-mufīd al-ṭālibīn, wa-murabbī al-murīdīn, wa-sālik ṭarīq al-ṣāliḥīn, al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAlwān al-Ḥamawī al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-Muslimīn, fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-nabī al-ummī, al-ṭāhir al-zakī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak fī aḥwāz al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, Wajīh ibn Aḥmad Bā ʻAshan, ghafara Allāh lahu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Ḥurrira fī 3 Mawlid Thānī, 1251 [29 July, 1835]."
On folios 48b-49b: Miscellaneous wisdom poems attributed to different authors.

Author's colophon (folio 47b): "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Wa-hunnā tamma hādhā al-Mukhtaṣar, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, waqt al-ẓuhr, fī al-yawm al-sādis min Rabīʻ al-Awwal al-anwar, sanat arbaʻ ʻashar wa-tisʻimiʼah, wa-sammaytuhu 'Taqrīb al-fawāʼid wa-tasʹhīl al-maqāṣid'. Wa-billāh al-tawfīq waḥdahu."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author said: Herein, this Abridgement is completed, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, at noon time, 6 Rabīʻ al-Awwal al-anwar, the year 914 [of the Hijrah = 15 July, 1508]. I titled it 'Taqrīb al-fawāʼid wa-tasʹhīl al-maqāṣid' [Approximation of benefits and facilitation of intentions]. Success is from God alone."

Copyist's colophon (folio 48a): "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, li-khams ʻashar khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-iḥdá wa-khamsīn min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá al-Karīm al-Jawwād, al-rājī ghafr al-masāwī, Muḥammad ibn al-ʻUmdah al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-ʻAllāmah al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Tamrāwī, Abū al-ʻAmāʼim laqaban, al-Ḥanafī sulūkan, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban. Ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Sunday, 15 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1251 of the Hijrah of Him, to whom belongs nobleness and honor [i.e. Prophet Muḥammad], may God pray on him and grant him peace, by the hand of the poorest of servants to the Generous and Most Benevolent One, who hopes for the forgiveness of [his] shortcomings, Muḥammad ibn al-ʻUmdah al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-ʻAllāmah al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Tamrāwī, Abū al-ʻAmāʼim laqaban, al-Ḥanafī sulūkan, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban. May God forgive him, his parents and the Muslims. Amen."

title: 880-02 al-Tathbīt ʻinda al-tabyīt : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.

notes.text: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá al-Islāmi // wa-al-shukru lillāhi ʻalá al-inʻāmi. Wa-afḍalu al-ṣalāti wa-al-thanāʼi // ʻalá al-Nabīyi Khātim al-Anbiyāʼi. Wa-ālihi ahli al-nuhá wa-ṣaḥbi-hi // wa-jundihi ahli al-tuqá wa-ḥizbihi ..."
Secundo folio: Bi-annamā al-idrāk maʻnan yukhlaqu.
14.5 x 20.3 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
